loans.name: Lamela

texts.en:
Lamela is 43 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, cereals, etc.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Lamela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mishi operates a vegetable stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 28 лет, замужем, есть сын школьник. Образование - среднее. Около 7 лет назад начала заниматься торговлей одеждой на местном рынке. Благодаря непосильному труду Кызжибек и ее емкой работе, она достигла хороших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 16,000 сом (KGS). У нее уже наработаны постоянные покупатели и поставщики одежды.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кызжибек обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 2,000 долларов (USD) на покупку зимних женских курток для увеличения товарооборота и расширения ассортимента, что позволит Кызжибек привлечь больше покупателей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kyzzhibek is 28 years old, married, and has a school-aged son.  She has a secondary education.  About 7 years ago she started selling clothes at the local market.  Thanks to her tireless efforts, Kyzzhibek has successfully grown her business; she is making a monthly profit of about 16,000 KGS, and already has loyal customers and clothing suppliers.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Kyzzhibek turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 2,000 US dollars to purchase women's winter jackets to expand her inventory and to attract new customers.  She plans to invest income from the loan back into the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's jackets to expand her inventory and to attract new customers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 62 years old and single. She lives in San Apolinario, Tangub City. Helen is managing her rice farm to earn a living, and she is also engaged in a hog raising business. Helen mastered doing this type of activity over twenty years. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on May 2012. She is hardworking and has a strong determination to pursue her goals to sustain her needs, alleviating poverty. 

Helen requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields on her rice farm, and also to buy additional piglets, animal feeds and vitamins. This will greatly help Helen boost her income. 

Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand her farm and venture into the rice retailing business. Helen is now supporting her nephew in his college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to increase production on her rice farm, and also to buy additional piglets, animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and cereals.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely has a retail shop in Oloitoktok town and has been running this business for 2 years now. He is 28 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and wheat flour to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future he hopes to have a prosperous business, be able to provide his family with the basic needs and also buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Sherie May

texts.en:
Sherie May, a 36-year-old resident of Coron, Palawan City, Philippines, is married to Ricky, a construction worker, and has one child who is still in the Preparatory Level in school. She manages her household while operating her business, working hard to  augment the family's income to meet their daily household needs and for the future of her child.

Sherie May has a direct-selling business, vending clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Natasha and Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at prices lower than the ones shown in the customer catalogue and then sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, Sherie May is requesting a Php 50000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries and undergarments to add to her inventory in preparation for Christmas sales.  Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality.  She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.   

Sherie May hopes to grow her business and give her family a bright future. She wants to send her child to school through to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for personal products such as underwear, beauty products, clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Martha Eliana

texts.es:
Martha una pulida, creativa, alegre y trabajadora mujer dedicada al arte de las manualidades y que viene con un proyecto de fabricar los adornos caseros para el mes de diciembre ya que en Colombia es tradición adornar las cosas con estos muñecos como los que podemos ver la foto y que debido a su falta de capital no puede explotar más.
Gracias a sus hermosos diseños los clientes están fascinados y le piden surtido pero ella no tiene como comprar la materia prima que necesita para poder realizar su arte y es por eso que requiere un crédito que invertirá en la compra de telas, cintas, adornos, pegantes, icopor, relleno Para sus muñecos esperando que estos sirvan para alegrar un hogar en este mes que aproxima.
texts.en:
Martha is a neat, creative, happy, and hardworking woman who makes a living through handicrafts.  This includes a project of making homemade decorations for the month of December, because in Colombia it's a tradition to decorate the houses with the kind of stuffed dolls you can see in the photo.  Due to her lack of capital, she cannot make any more.

Thanks to her beautiful designs the customers are fascinated and ask for an assortment, but she is not able to buy the raw materials necessary to make her art.  This is why she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, ribbons, trim, glue, styrofoam, and stuffing to make her dolls, hoping that they will serve to brighten up a home in the upcoming month.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, ribbons, trim, glue, styrofoam, and stuffing to make her beautiful crafts.

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Рысбубу на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, благодаря упорному труду Рысбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Рысбубу, она также помогает своим детям и внукам, которые в свою очередь активно помогают по хозяйству. Накопленные средства семья старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Рысбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее деятельности, что позволит улучшить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Rysbubu is 59 years old, widowed, and the mother of 3 children.  Rysbubu is on pension, but her work in livestock serves as the primary source of income for her and her family.  Thanks to Rysbubu's hard work, she now has 5 cows and 10 sheep.  Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.  These funds fail catastrophically to meet the needs of Rysbubu - she also helps her children and grandchildren who in turn actively help with the business.  The family is trying to put all of their savings toward the expansion and growth of the business.  Rysbubu turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow to increase the size of her herd.  She plans to reinvest income from the loan back into her business in order to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase the size of her herd and to increase her income

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diosdada is 43 years old and her one child is in school.

Diosdada has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her manicure and pedicure services.

Diosdada has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood like boards, planks and cane taking advantage that the majority of houses in the area are made of these and a supplier is needed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceiling materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in order to be able to fertilize 16 orange trees and 120 mandarin trees.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a native from Dulag, Leyte. She is 41 years old and a mother of a four-year-old child. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells candies, sugar, powdered milk, spices, biscuits, noodles and canned goods. She has been operating the store for more than 10 years. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs to augment her income.

Marites has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a variety of stock for the store and to buy pig feed. In the future, Marites would like to expand both of her businesses for the welfare of her child.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock for the store and to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 39 years old and is residing in Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis.Occ. She is a single mom with 1 child who is now in high school. She joined PMPC in July of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. 

Recently, she is accessing her 3rd loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to have additional working capital for her existing business in order to buy more of a variety of dried fish and spices to sell. Mila hopes that her business will grow to continuously support her daughter in getting a degree in college.

loans.use: to have additional working capital for her existing business in order to buy more of a variety of dried fish and spices to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a businesswoman from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married, and has an expertise for sales.

Marcelina runs a little sari-sari store from their house, she is also engaged in buying and selling dried fish. She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Marcelina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for stock of dried fish to sell in the local community.

Marcelina continues to look for better business opportunities: proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for stock of dried fish to sell in the local community

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nelson Gilberto

texts.es:
Nelson Gilberto es un joven de 27 años que habita en el municipio de El Sauce ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua.
Se desempeña como operario de limpieza donde su trabajo consiste en barrer las principales calles del municipio. A diario se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar sus labores a las cinco de la mañana, es un trabajo bien cansado que se realiza de sol a sol y en ocasiones debajo de lluvias pero sin embargo no se queja de esto porque gracias a ello lleva el  pan de cada día a su hogar y ayuda a sus padres en lo que puede.
Se siente muy agradecido del apoyo que ha recibido de los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel porque gracias a ello pudo mejorar un poco la salud de su padre de un accidente que lo dejó con impedimento de uno de sus pies.
Hoy en la actualidad necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar medicamentos, realización de exámenes médicos, para poder controlar este problema de salud que tiene su papá y que necesitan estar chequeando y en terapia con el fin de que él no se complique.
Espera que le sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
Nelson Gilberto is 27 years old and lives in the municipality of El Sauce located in the west of Nicaragua.

He works as a cleaner, his work consists of sweeping the main streets of the municipality. He gets up at 4 am each day to start his work at 5 am. It is a tiring job that he does from when the sun comes up to sundown. Sometimes he works in the rain. But nevertheless he doesn't complain because thanks to this job he earns his daily bread and he helps his parents as much as he can.

He is very grateful for the support that he has received from the Kiva lenders and Ceprodel. Thanks to that he can improve his father's health who was in an accident that left an impediment in one of his feet. He needs this loan now to buy medicine and to pay for medical examinations to take care of this problem that his father has with his health. His father needs to be checked and undergo therapy to avoid complications. He hopes to be supported once again.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Jose Jacobo

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar salir adelante, el quiere mejor su vivienda repellando las paredes, cambio de techo y poner las puertas, pero no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, laminas, polines, puertas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Jose, 33 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and child. He makes a living farming and sells his produce in the various markets. He manages to move forward with what he obtains from his sales. He wants to improve his home by plastering the walls, changing the roof and putting up doors but he does not have enough money to do so. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, planks and doors and to pay labor costs so that he and his family can live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, planks, doors and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children who are of school age. She has been engaged in a coconut buying and selling business for 5 years already. She earns approximately PHP3,500 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is very helpful in supporting her financial needs. 

She has requested a loan to buy more coconuts for selling and for copra processing. Conchita has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut buying and selling business by establishing her own coconut buying station.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for selling and for copra processing.

loans.name: Noflina

texts.en:
Noflina, age 51, is a hardworking woman who seeks additional income for her family by running a transportation business (using a public minivan, called a “bemo”), a boarding house, and by selling ice cubes. She has been engaged in these business for years.

These businesses have brought greatly contributed to Noflina and her family's lives by fulfilling their daily needs including meals and the cost of education for her 3 children who are at school.

Noflina is working hard to gain extra money as she did not want to solely rely on her husband who is a truck driver. However, she has had to deal with a difficult situation lately, as her transportation business is not running well. The minivan is broken and needs to be repaired. Therefore, she asks for an individual loan of IDR 5,000,000 to TLM. The loan will be used to cover the cost of repairs in the workshop.

loans.use: to cover repair costs for her minivan

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa has a live-in woman partner with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a business of selling souvenir items in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 12 years.  Marissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more souvenir items to sell to her customers. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenir items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.fr: ATSOUPI est mariée et mère de  deux enfants et est âgée de 28 ans ; elle est commerçante des œufs et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché du quartier ; elle vit à Tokoin dans une maison dont le toit est en tôle, leur latrine est du type traditionnel et a un niveau secondaire, même se nourrit une fois par jours. ATSOUPI sollicite un crédit pour améliorer son quotidien, agrandir son étalage, augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire afin de mieux épargner et réaliser l’un de ses rêves qui est de vivre dans sa propre maison.
texts.en: Atsoupi is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She sells eggs and buys her goods once a month at the local market.  She lives in Tokoin in a house with a roof made of corrugated iron.  The family's toilet is of the traditional type.  Atsoupi has a secondary education and eats once a day.  She is taking a loan to improve her daily life and to increase her inventory and her profit margin.  Her goal is to save enough money to see one of her dreams come true: she would like to live in her own house.

loans.use: to buy 45 egg trays.

loans.name: Dora De Jesus

texts.es: Dora de 59  años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 12  años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora is 59 years old and lives in her own home along with her mother. She has been producing clothes for 12 years from a workshop that is located in her house. Dora has many customers because of the quality of the clothes that she produces.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, elastics, and other supplies so that she can continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, elastics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 3 children who are now grown adults.

Jose has been engaged in rice production activities for 20 years now; it is his main source of income. He earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used to pay the labor cost on riceland preparation, planting, and purchasing fertilizers and sprays.

Jose has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Jose hopes to expand his rice production activity by acquiring more parcels of Riceland.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost of riceland preparation, planting, and purchasing fertilizers and sprays

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 40 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with two children. 

He does farming in Oloitoktok, where he keeps dairy cattle and also grows maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. He has been in this business for three years. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on his farm. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business and be prosperous

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Kalipa

texts.ru: Калипа, 55 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Калипа на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1993 году. Благодаря упорному труду Калипы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Калипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kalipa is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children.  Kalipa is on pension, but her work in animal husbandry, which began in 1993, serves as the primary source of income for her family.  Thanks to Kalipa's hard work, she now has 4 cows.  With the goal of further expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase cattle to increase the size of her herd.  With the income earned from the loan, Kalipa plans to further invest in increasing her numbers of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en:
Nerisa is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old.

Nerisa has a fish/dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and dried fish to sell.

In the future, Nerisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Un almacén de tienda de repuestos de motocicleta y artículos varios son la es lo que mantiene viva la ilusión de la señora Sandra, ya que su sueño es salir adelante, mejorar su situación económica y pensar en tener una familia, pues no considera justo traer al mundo una criatura a pasar necesidades por ello trabaja incansablemente todos los días 8 horas para generar su propio sustento. 
Ella nunca había pensado en crecer y ahora que interactuar le da la oportunidad de prestarle dinero la quiere tomar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y permitirse soñar en comprar una casa, solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos de motocicleta en general, ayudándole a conseguir mas clientes para que se antojen de los bellos artículos que tiene para ellos.
texts.en: A store full of motorcycle parts and a variety of items are what keeps Sandra's hopes alive. Her dream is to get ahead, improve her financial situation and think of having a family. She doesn't think that it is right to bring a child into the world to go without. So she works ceaselessly 8 hours every day to generate her own sustenance.  She never thought about expanding but now Interactuar is giving her the opportunity to borrow money. She wants to use it to improve her living conditions and allow herself to dream of buying a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase motorcycle parts in general which will help her to gain more clients so that they can crave the beautiful items that she has for them.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a hardworking mother who is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of mango fruit for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more mangoes, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of mango fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pilar has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of fish to sell.

In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of fish to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diosdada is 43 years old now.

Diosdada has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Diosdada has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so  that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ponaliza

texts.en:
Ponaliza is 26 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Ponaliza is in the agricultural business: pig fattening in the Philippines. Ponaliza requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ponaliza would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melinda is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Melinda has an accessories and souvenir sales business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more accessories and souvenirs to sell to her customers.

Melinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories and souviners to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 56 лет, замужем, есть 7 детей. У Гулмиры среднее образование, она работает техничкой и уже 28 лет занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Гулмиры есть земельный участок мерою 0,82 Га собственной и 0,18 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает хлопок и кукурузу. Также есть 4 коровы и 10 овец. Экологически чистые и вкусные продукты пользуются большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Гулмиры составляет в среднем 17,000 сомов (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит скот для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулмире увеличить ее доходы и улучшить материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en: Gulmira is 56 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Gulmira has a secondary education and works as a cleaner, but has worked in agricultures and animal husbandry for 28 years.  She has her own 0.82 hectare plot of land and rents an additional 0.18 hectare plot, on which she raises cotton and corn.  She also has 4 cows and 10 sheep.  Eco-friendly and delicious produce is in high demand.  Gulmira's monthly income averages 17,000 KGS.  She turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle to fatten and resell.  The profits from the income will allow Gulmira to increase her income and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Rosa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Al Amana Group

texts.en:
Al Amana group consists of three hardworking ladies: Wadad, who's the featured borrower and the two sisters Randa and Sawsan. All of them decided to put their hands together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to improve their businesses and living.

Wadad is a 42-year-old married mother of two who opened her own cafe in 2009, with 11 years of experience in this domain, after she used to sell clothes at her house. Wadad is an ambitious woman, who works hard to develop her career and family's living. Today, she has a successful business, which she is developing gradually to reach a wider one in the future.

One of Wadad's plans is to start preparing and selling tasty crepes to her customers, so that in the future, she can provide extra tasty creative sweets.  Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special crepe making machine which will develop her business and increase her income in an impressive way.

Wadad is the first lady on the right, Randa at the center, and Sawsan is on the left.

loans.use: To buy a special crepe making machine which will develop her business and increase her income

loans.name: Borgho's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Ce groupe vient d’entamer son troisième, il est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’aviculture.

Madame Borgho (assise à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles. C’est une femme très déterminée à faire prospérer ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés  et divers articles vestimentaires, les derniers cités sont achetés dans la capitale en compagnie d’autres camarades vendeuses pour la revente par détail. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.
  
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter une trentaine de prêt à porter pour enfant en vu de les vendre par pièces.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et d’apporter son  soutien à son marie dans gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Created at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois, this group is just taking its third loan. The group is made up of very energetic women who share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance, as they have been living in the same neighborhood for several years. Their main activity is small retail business and poultry farming.

Borgho is the group's featured borrower (in the photo, she is the woman sitting third from the left). She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children (two boys and four girls). She is very determined to see her income-generating activities prosper. She is very active as a seller of dyed fabrics and clothing items. Together with some friends who are in the same business, she buys clothes in the capital city and then resells her merchandise on a retail basis. She has been involved in this activity for more than 10 years. She plans to use her new loan to buy about 30 ready-to-wear clothing items for children and to resell them on a retail basis. The profits that she will be making thanks to this activity will enable her to save enough money to increase her financing capacity, and also to help her husband with the management of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy about 30 ready-to-wear clothing items for children, in order to resell them on a retail basis.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
38-year-old Melchora is a merchant, operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like eggs, cooking oil, spices, canned goods, shampoo and soft drinks. She has five children. Her oldest is 21 and the youngest is 9.

Her husband is a carpenter. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. Despite that, they still do not have enough funds to sustain their way of life, 

Melchora has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks like beverages, noodles, biscuits, toiletries and soft drinks. The additional stocks will help attract more customers and increase her yield.

Melchora dreams of expanding her business to augment their livelihood and also support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items like beverages, noodles, biscuits, toiletries and soft drinks

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 54-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Henedino, a mason, and has two children. She manages her own household while operating the business. It is heartbreaking to see her family live in a makeshift shelter with their small child, but she works hard to augment their income for their daily personal and household needs.

Emily has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than what's shown on the catalog of the customers and then sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every week.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of clothes, such as t-shirts, shorts, beauty products and toiletries, for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. Emily is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her as it will greatly cover her family's daily needs.   

Emily aims to grow her business and hopes to own a franchise someday. She wants to send her children to school and prays for a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and clothes, such as uniforms, t-shirts, shorts and toiletries, to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John does farming in Oloitoktok town and he has been in this business for the past three years. He is 24 years old and he supports his parents. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as pay for laborers to cultivate his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his farming business and save more money. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be prosperous in life

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in Bagumbang, Bonifacio. For the past twenty years, Emma and her husband have been farmers. She earns 15,000 PHP each cropping from focusing on her rice farm. 

Emma became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm.

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es: Irma de 43 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Irma esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: 43-year-old Irma lives alone in her own house. She sells second-hand clothes. Her business in located in her home and she has a lot of return customers due to the quality of the clothing and good prices. Irma is applying for a loan in order to buy clothing in bulk in order to continue selling and have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 24 years of age and single. She lives in Manga, Tangub City. She is earning a profit through her sari-sari store (general store) business. She is a determined, young business woman who never looses hope in pursuing her goals, despite the odds she meets halfway. She never gets tired of tending her store since she has a driven passion in selling and she earns a meager income from it. 

Desiree is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. She has now applied for a loan to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store (general store) in order to draw more customers to buy in her store and increase her sales. Desiree continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the strong will and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store (grocery store) in order to draw more customers to buy in her store and increase her sales.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is 28 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Adriana is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

Adriana has been raising goats for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es:
Abonos, riegos e insumos agrícolas son los elementos que requiere el señor Alirio un campesino, solitario, que no tiene familia ni el apoyo de alguien por eso se refugia en la corporación interactuar y en la posibilidad del gran proyecto kiva que pusieron a su alcance. 
Se siente muy motivado y sonriente al saber que alguien lo apoya y le da no solo un monto de dinero si no el apoyo incondicional y el aliento de saber que es capaz de levantar esas tierras que un día su padre les dejos, por eso quiere decir gracias por ser unas personas que creen en él, y de hacerle saber que su trabajo es importante.
texts.en:
Compost, water, and agricultural supplies are the elements that Señor Allrio, a farmer, needs. He is single and has no family nor the support of anyone. For this reason, he has turned to the Interactuar corporation and the possibility of the great Kiva project, which they have put within his reach.

He feels very motivated and smiling to know that someone can help him and that they will give him not only a certain amount of money but also their unconditional support and relief of knowing that he is capable of lifting up these lands that one day his father will leave him. For this reason, he wants to say thank you for being one of the people who believe in him and for letting it be known that his work is important.

loans.use: to pay for compost, water, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is a 25 year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of her income.
Cherrylyn is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. This loan will help her improve her fishing business, thus augmenting her income.
Cherrylyn hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 26 years old. She is married to Richard, and together they have been blessed with three children. Richard provides additional income for his family.

Sarah sells cereals, a business she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 3,000.

Sarah has requested her first loan of Kshs.10,000 from VisionFund Kenya.  She will use it to buy stock of assorted cereals like dried maize, sorghum, millet, beans, and baking flour for making mandazis to sell, as well.

With the anticipated profits, Sarah will be able to live a better life and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy stock of  assorted cereals

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is from Manga, Tangub City. She is a 25-year-old single mom with one school-aged child. She is earning a living through her small grocery store business. To generate more income, Sheryl decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can avail financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her store to increase inventories and sales. 

Sheryl smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her son with a good education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store to increase inventories and sales.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 51 years old and married.  She has three children.  Arcelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Arcelita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fruits and food vending.  Arcelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Naomi from Eldoret Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but one who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with four lovely children. 

For the past 10 years, Naomi has been practicing mixed farming and, due to the experience she has, commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers who regard her as a mentor. Selling milk, eggs and vegetable has allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Naomi also engages in a small personal business. 
 
Naomi passionately loves dairy farming, and one of the animals on her farm has been given the name of “Chesker.” Milking and feeding Chesker makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers. 

Because demand has been overwhelming, Naomi is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow, a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce 10-20 litres of rich, creamy milk daily. The increased milk production will result in more income, and Naomi will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children. 

When people listen to Naomi speak, they can be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming because of her passion and determination. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Naomi, and there is no doubt that rewarding employment can be found in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy una carismática joven de 19 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de productos de uso domestico, actividad que adopta para poder pagar sus estudios, ya que nació bajo el seno de una familia humilde y quiere salir adelante y progresar para darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos de domestico o consumo personal de la marca amway y así seguir teniendo la oportunidad de pagar sus estudios
texts.en: Leidy is a charismatic young woman of 19 who sells products for domestic use, an activity she undertook in order to be able to pay for her education, since she was born into the bosom of a family of humble means, and she wants to get ahead and progress in order to give her family a good quality of life. She is applying for a loan to purchase Amway brand products for domestic or personal use and thus continue having the opportunity to pay for her education.

loans.use: to buy Amway domestic products

loans.name: Lenis Arcenia

texts.es:
Lenis, una mujer con todos los ánimos de trabajas, que se desempeña realizando servicios de manicura, y pedicura, una actividad con la que puede cubrir sus gastos y llevar su sustento a su hogar, que en realidad vive sola por eso es tan importante el negocio para ella pues es lo que más le gusta y sabe hacer.
Solicita un crédito parta la compra de una silla de manicura y pedicura, con la que puede atender mejor sus clientes, y hacer de su negocio un lugar más buscado para ellos, que es su intención hacerlo comercial y llenarse de muchos clientes, juntando capital para algún día montar un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Lenis is a woman with all the spirit for work. Her work is providing manicure and pedicure services, a business with which she can cover her expenses and bring sustenance to her household, where she in fact lives alone. For this reason, the business is very important for her, since it is what she likes most and knows how to do.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of a manicure and pedicure chair, with which she will be able to serve her customers better and make her business a place more sought out by them. Her intention is to make it a place of business and fill it with many customers, and to raise capital so that some day she can set up a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a chair for providing manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en: Etidal has previously asked for a loan to pay for her son's semester fees. Her son has already passed a year successfully by paying that year's fees. Now, she is requesting another loan for the current semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en:
Yassin sells phones and phone accessories and has been in this business for three years. He is 23 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with one child. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of phones, phone chargers, and batteries, as well as phone covers to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to be successful in his business and be able to provide the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Horacio

texts.es:
Jesús un hombre al cual la vida le dio una gran alegría hace 9 años cuando nació su hija y hoy a sus 67 años de edad y a pesar de tener un trabajo humilde quiere hacer lo posible para dejarle una casa propia.
Trabaja en su negocio de tienda general el cal necesita un impulso económico, para ello quiere un aliento monetario que invertirá en la compra de surtido en productos de la canasta familiar. Jesús tiene un sueño y está muy empeñado en ello, dejarle una casa  a su hija.
texts.en: Jesús is a man who life afforded a great happiness when his daughter was born 9 years ago. And today at 67 years of age, despite having to do a humble job, he wants to do everything possible to leave her her own house. He works in his business which is a general store which needs an economic boost. To do this he needs monetary encouragement that he will invest in the purchase of a variety of basic food products. Jesús has a dream and he is very determined to leave a house for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy basic food items to amass capital and leave an inheritance for his daughter.

loans.name: Ansata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de   femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles jouissent d’une très bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et pratiquent aussi l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Ansata (debout  l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, malgré son jeune âge, elle demeure une femme très dynamique. Elle est aussi très active dans le bon fonctionnement du groupement.  Elle est mère de 08 enfants (02 garçons et 06 filles). Elle est vendeuse de divers produits alimentaires à savoir : le sucre, l’huile végétale, l’ognon,  la tomate et divers bouillons culinaires. Elle achète en gros et demi gros auprès de grossiste au marché central pour la revente au détail dans son village où elle tient une table. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en huile pour un bidon de 20 litres, de la tomate 02 pots de 500 gr, un sac d’ognon, 02 sacs de sucre, 05 paquets de thé vert et divers bouillons pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  en partie  et  de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des frais scolaires des enfants et de participer à une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 2nd, 2002, during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. It is made up of women who are strongly dedicated to their work, and who have a good experience of the Banc Villageois system. They all come from the same village. Their main activity is small retail business, and they are also involved in rain-fed crop farming.

Ansata is the group's featured borrower. In the photo, she is standing at the far right and raising her hand. She is 44 years old and, in spite of her young age, she is a very energetic woman. She is also a very active member of the group. She is the mother of eight children (two boys and six girls), and she sells various food products such as sugar, vegetable oil, onions, tomatoes and various stocks for the preparation of dishes. She buys her goods in bulk and semi-bulk quantities from wholesalers at the central market. She resells her goods on a retail basis in her village where she has her own stall. She has a great deal of experience in her field, as she has been involved in this activity for several years.

She plans to use her loan to get a 20-liter can of oil, two cans of tomatoes each weighing 500 grams, one bag of onions, two bags of sugar, five packets of green tea and various stocks for the preparation of dishes, all for resale.

Thanks to the profits from her activity, she will be able to save some money and help her husband cover the children's school fees. She will also be able to take better care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a 20-liter can of oil, two cans of tomatoes each weighing 500 grams, one bag of onions, two bags of sugar, five packets of green tea etc., for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jacquiline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now. Jacquiline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jairo Alonso

texts.es:
Jairo un hombre emprendedor, creativo, e ingenioso que por necesidad económica y ante la falta de oportunidades laborales monto un negocio de restaurante, con poco capital y falto de maquinaria que quiere progresar y mejorar su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito que invertirá en al compra de una fritadora industrial lo cal le hace mucha falta para agilizar sus preparaciones, y servir las comidas más rápida para darle un servicio oportuno a sus clientes. 
Jairo de verdad tiene una gran necesidad y por ello pone su fe en el buen corazón de los prestamistas para sacar su restaurante adelante y algún día poder cumplir su sueño de abrir nuevos locales y hacer llegar sus restaurantes a todos los rincones de Colombia
texts.en: Jairo is a hard-working, creative, and ingenious man who opened a restaurant with little capital due to economic need and a lack of sources of work. He lacks machinery that he needs to move forward and improve his business. For this, he is applying for a loan that he will invest in an industrial fryer which he needs to facilitate food preparation and serve it more quickly to give his clients better service. Jairo truly has a great need and he has faith in the good hearts of investors will help his restaurant move forward and he will someday be able to fulfill his dream of opening new stores and bringing his restaurants to all corners of Colombia.

loans.use: to buy an industrial fryer which he urgently needs for his business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to renovate her house

loans.name: Hermelen

texts.en:
Hermelen is 34 years old, married, and resident of Ventura, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have two children, and both of them are in school.  Starting with capitalization of 1,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last May 2014 and took out the first loan. 

Now she is applying for 4,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  Someday in the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Pilarica

texts.en:
Pilarica is 48 years old and widowed with six children.

Pilarica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, candies, snack foods, shampoo, and other items to sell in her general store.

Pilarica has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from dress making.

Pilarica aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, candies, snack foods, shampoo, and other items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Atyrgul

texts.ru: Атыргул 42 года, замужем, 2 детей - школьников. Образование у Атыргул среднее. Она работает уборщицей, супруг делает ремонты на заказ. Ежемесячный доход Атыргул составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В этом году Атыргул решила сделать дома ремонт  и достроить баню на территории дома. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кирпичей и котла для бани, а также ремонта в доме. Сэкономленную благодаря получению кредита свою заработную плату, Атыргул направит на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Atyrgul is 42, married, and has two children in grade school.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and works as a maid, while her husband renovates and repairs homes as a contractor.  Her monthly income is around 6,000 som.  Earlier this year, Atyrgul decided to renovate her home, and wants to finish building a new bathroom in particular.  She's seeking a loan of 20,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy bricks and and a boiler for her bathroom, as well as to make other improvements in her home.  With the extra money this will allow her to set aside from her job, Atyrgul will be able to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: purchase bricks and a boiler to finish building a bathroom, as well as make other improvements to her home

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar, 45 years, deals in agriculture, especially sugar cane growing. His additional income is from maize growing. 

He began the business to have a source of income. He will use the loan to buy mulch for the sugar cane. He hopes this will increase his yields and income in the long run. 

His customers are the general public. He hopes to improve his family status with the increased income. His challenge is limited income. He thanks UGAFODE for the financial boost. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age and school age. Hazel has been engaged in agri-business activity, particularly in rice production for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. Her husband also supports their family from his income as a teacher. 

She has requested a loan to be used to pay the labor cost for land preparation and planting, and the remaining amount to purchase commercial fertilizers and insecticides sprays.  Hazel has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her agri-business by means of acquiring an additional parcel of rice land.

loans.use: to pay the cost of land preparation and to purchase fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is 44 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with two children. He has a store that sells canned goods, junk foods, and rice. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan to buy five sacks of rice to sustain the daily needs of his neighbors for more sales. He has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Danilo hopes that his store will become a mini mart and sustain the studies of his children.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hanaly

texts.en:
Hanaly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a buy and sell soft drinks business in the Philippines. Hanaly requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

Hanaly has been in this business for 15 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Ann does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Chuka area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with two adorable children. 

For the past ten years she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Ann is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Ann could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Ann, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Ann believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. 

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Ann to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Vergelio

texts.en:
Vergelio has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting, and earning income as well. Vergelio has supported his family doing this type of work.

As a farmer, Vergelio has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase a good variety of seedlings for his farm, such as mango, papaya, durian, and banana. Someday, Vergelio hopes to purchase more agricultural land to cultivate, which would potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for his farm, such as mango, papaya, durian, and banana.

location.town: Tangub - San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now, and she earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials.

Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Edecia

texts.en:
Edecia is 57 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Edecia has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is a 45-year-old married woman, and she has four children ages 17,16,15 and 13 years old respectively. She has a hog raising business. She has been raising and selling hogs for more than 10 years. It serves as her main source of income. Her husband is a meat vendor.  

Because of the scarcity of capital to finance her hog raising activity, Rosie has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and pig feed. This will help her raise and sell more healthy pigs in the coming months.  Rosie is hoping that this is the start of improving her piggery business and will help their livelihood.  Rosie would like to expand her hog raising business to be successful someday, and will continue send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia lives in the municipality of Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She operates her own business venture and has raised hogs for her family's income generation. She has been in the business for 5 years and has one adult-aged child. Since she wanted to continue supporting her existing business, she borrows money through PMPC amounting to PHP 14,900. This is a great help for Patricia.

loans.use: To buy bags of feed and vitamins for growing hogs to financially support the family's needs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and has three children. She is a married woman, and she has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in agriculture for five years, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 49 years old and married with one child who is currently in school. For the past 20 years, he has run a general store in the Philippines where he sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, snack foods, eggs, cereals, beer, and other products.  Richard works very hard to provide for his family. 

Richard is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as noodles, coffee, snack foods, eggs, cereals, beers, and other products. In the future, he would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, snack foods, eggs, cereals, beers, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick to build a containment wall on her home.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 26 years old and married to Stephen. The couple is blessed with a four-year-old child. For the last three years, Millicent has been making and selling peanut butter, while Stephen supports the family with the additional income. She earns 40,000 KES each month. 

Millicent is requesting a 15,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a stock of groundnuts to make peanut butter. She will use the anticipated profits from her loan to provide for her family's basic needs. Millicent hopes to grow her business and to be stable in her business.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native basket and tray weaving business in the Philippines. Joelita has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Joelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past six years she has worked hard running a sari sari, or small general store in the Philippines She also earns additional income from raising chickens and reloading mobile phones.

Nicanora has borrowed and successfully repaid six loans from NWTF. She has now requested an 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional groceries to sell in her store. Her ambition is to build and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is married and works hard to support her family. For the past four years she has bought and sold ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Cornelia has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. Her ambition is to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rosemary, a youthful, 50-year-old shosho (old mum). She is a wise farmer, whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya. Rosemary is happily married and, together with her husband, blessed with five lovely children. For the past 14 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, bananas, and vegetables and also, she keeps dairy cows. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Rosemary mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Rosemary is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge that has caused her to suffer so many losses. Perishable products, such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes, require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Rosemary is going to achieve her dream and goal.

Accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle for women in Kenya. Rosemary feels relieved now, to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo (with help from Kiva) that help out women, so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Rosemary will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. In addition, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, increasing her income level. Rosemary is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping her in farm work. With your loan, Rosemary will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer en una mujer emprendedora con mucho carácter, y visión empresarial, tiene 30 años, es casada y madre de un niño de 5 años. Actualmente trabaja en su microempresa y estudia. Se dedica a organizar fiestas y todo tipo de eventos, sus servicios comprenden desde las invitaciones, decoración, centros de mesa, comidas, menús para niños y adultos, cajitas para confites, Cupcakes, globoflexia, inflables, animación, sonido, realización de videos y otros. Se inicio trabajando en una sala de eventos donde adquirió experiencia en esta actividad, además de capacitarse en las técnicas de pinta caritas, animación de fiestas, elaboración de chocolatería, dulces, queques  y otras actividades relacionadas. Su trabajo lo realiza con mucha pasión y esmero, le gusta mucho lo que hace y se siente realizada. Tiene experiencia de más de 2 años de brindar los servicios,  de forma independiente y junto con su esposo. 
Inicio su negocio comprando su primer inflable con un dinero de una liquidación laboral que le dio su esposo, de ahí gracias al buen manejo de los recursos han logrado capitalizar, hasta llegar a tener el patrimonio con el que cuenta actualmente. Esta inversión que esta solicitando es para la compra de equipo para mejorar el servicio que brinda y ser más atractivo para sus clientes. 
Su trabajo lo hace con mucha calidad y profesionalismo. Y sus objetivos son terminar de estudiar, mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su y adquirir casa propia.
texts.en:
Jennifer is an entrepreneurial woman of much character and vision. She is 30 years old, married, and mother of a 5 year old son. Today she has a business and studies in school. Her business is organizing parties and all kinds of events. Her services range from the invitations, decorations, center pieces, meals, menus for children and adults, gifts, cupcakes, inflatables, sound, video recording, etc. She began working in an event salon where she acquired experience in the field. In addition she taught herself face painting, party decorations, how to make chocolates, candies, cakes and other related activities. She works with a lot of passion and enthusiasm; she likes her work and feels fulfilled. She has had this business for more than 2 years and her husband works with her. She began her business buying her first inflatable with the money that her husband gave her from his work. From there, thanks to her good money management, they have grown the business to what they have today.

This loan will be used to buy equipment to improve the service that she provides and be more attractive to clients. She will buy a small inflatable, a headset microphone, bubble machine, double boilers, 50 meter extension cord. She does her work with great quality and professionalism. her goals are to complete her studies, improve her quality of life for herself and her family, and acquire their own home.

loans.use: to buy a small inflatable, a headset microphone, bubble machine, double boilers, 50 meter extension cord.

loans.name: Ma. Lizalde

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Lizalde works hard to support her family. She runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Ma. Lizalde has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.

Ma. Lizalde is requesting a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, vegetables, noodles, and other products for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, vegetables, noodles, and other items for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and married with one child.

Teodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Teodora has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Teodora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее, она работает завучем и преподавателем кыргызского языка в школе, также уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Батмы, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 3 коровы и 0,57 Га собственной, а также 1,20 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает хлопок, кукурузу, пшеницу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Батмы составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батма обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств она направит на оплату арендованной земли, в размере 1,20 Га. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, она хочет накопить средства на покупку земельного участка для выращивания на нем клевера.
texts.en: Batma is 54, married, and has three children.  She has a university education and works as a vice principal and Kyrgyz language teacher at a school in addition to growing crops and raising livestock for several years, and earns roughly 15,000 som each month.  Thanks to her persistence and patience, her farm is doing quite well; she owns 0.57 hectares of land and rents an additional 1.20 hectares to grow cotton, corn, wheat and clover as cash crops, and also has three cows.  To further develop her farm, Batma is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy more livestock and pay rent for her 1.20-hectare plot of land.
