Haydee ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank, “Las Amistosas,” which is located in the Urcos district – part of the Province of Quispicanchi and Department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Haydee. She is married, 35 years old and has four children. She works in her restaurant business and prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups and sautéed meat. 

She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has been in the business for 10 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the restaurant. She is asking for a loan to purchase cooking supplies such as chicken, beef and vegetables. 

The member is attached to the group photo. They took her photo after the meeting, as she was unable to attend because of work. 

The other members make a living by selling animals, selling vegetables, selling groceries and working in a restaurant.  

Mrs. Haydee thanks all those who support her dream through Kiva and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Yi Jin

texts.en:
Yi Jin is a 40-year-old blind man. He is currently single with one child who is six years old who is attending school. Six years ago, he had a girlfriend who is also blind. They had a daughter together. Shortly after their daughter was born, his girlfriend left him and their daughter. 

In order to support his family and to raise his daughter, he began learning the skills of blind massaging, and opened a massage shop three years ago. Unfortunately, in August 2014, his apprentice in his massage shop drowned in the river in a freak accident. He compensated the family of the apprentice ¥80,000. A part of this money came from his savings while he borrowed the rest from his relatives and friends.

As his relatives and friends require money urgently now, Yi Jin has to pay back his debts. He requested the loan of ¥15,000 to pay his debts and for the operation of his massage shop. He is confident of his business and he is determined to work hard to pay back this loan and to support his family.

loans.use: To pay debts and for the operation of a massage shop.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Enelita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional material and gear for her fishing business.

In the future, Enelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional material and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Loremae

texts.en:
Loremae is 23 years old and married with one child.

Loremae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Loremae has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Loremae aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rony Alfredo

texts.es:
Rony es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Santiago junto a su familia. Desde hace varios años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus clientes, es responsable y muy trabajador.
Rony tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder hacer mejoras en su casa como pintarrajear y reforzar las paredes de su vivienda. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad porque con esto su familia estará más segura y cómoda y así continuará esforzándose por el bienestar de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Rony is a very enterprising young man who has a great desire to get ahead. He is single and lives with his family in Santiago. For a number of years Rony has worked providing transport services in his city. He thinks that this is going well because he always worries about his customers' well-being and he is responsible and very hard-working.

Rony wants to improve his family's quality of life and so is thinking of using this loan to make some improvements to his home, such as daubing and strengthening the walls. Rony is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the generosity as, with this loan, his family will be more secure and comfortable. Rony can then continue to put in the effort to look after his family's well-being.

loans.use: to strengthen and daub the walls of his home.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 15 Mai 2009 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même quartier elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Awa (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 03 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle tient une table au marché central de la commune où elle vend des légumes frais et divers condiments. Elle s’approvisionne par le biais de véhicules en provenance des zones maraîchères du nord et centre ouest. Elle bénéficie aussi de l’appui de sa fille les jours non ouvrables.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 300 kg d’ognon, 02 cartons d’épices, 05 sacs de pomme de terre, 25 kg de poisson sec, 250 kg de choux pour la revente. 

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte accompagner son mari pour l’acquisition d’un terrain destiné à la construction d’un habitat familial.
texts.en:
This group was inaugurated on the 15th of May 2009. The women who make it up all come from the same district and are all blood relations or colleagues. They are very supportive of each other and are principally small retailers.

Awa (the woman standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 3 children, all girls. She has a table at the commune's central market where she sells fresh vegetables and condiments. She gets her supplies from vehicles which come from the farming grounds located in the northern and west central areas. She also benefits from her daughter's help on non-working days. She plans to use her new loan to buy 300 kilos of onions, 2 boxes of spices, 5 bags of potatoes, 25 kilos of dried  fish and 250 kilos of cabbages for resale. She plans to use her profits to support her husband with the acquisition of a plot of land on which to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy 300 kilos of onions, 2 boxes of spices, 5 bags of potatoes, 25 kilos of dried  fish and 250 kilos of cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y ventanas, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar laminas, polines, vidrios de ventanas, balcones y pago de mano de obra para poder realizarlo y asi ella y su hija puedan vivir más seguras.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years and lives in her own house with her daughter. She makes a living selling snacks, and with the income she receives, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. 

She wants to improve her house by changing the roof and the windows. However, she does not earn enough to be able to undertake the work, and so she is asking for a loan, to be used to buy sheets, purlins, window panes, safety bars and labour. By making these improvements, she and her daughter will be able to live more safely.

loans.use: to buy sheets, purlins, window panes, safety bars and labour.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario tiene 37 años de edad es padre soltero y vive en casa propia con su hija, el posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Mario está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario, 37, is a single father who lives in his own house with his daughter.  For five years he has been running a small store set up in his home; and he has many customers because of his low prices and attentive customer service.  Mario is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. so ha can improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Susana Isabel

texts.es: Susana de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, Susana solicita un préstamo para poder comprar  mas frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en: Susana, 35, lives in her own house with her two children.  She is a very hard worker who dedicates all her time to her business in an effort to get ahead and give her family a better lifestyle.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand in the market near her home and has been in business for four years.  Susana is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.  This will allow her to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 15 Mai 2009 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même quartier elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Aissatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et prend en charge ses deux garçons âgés de 07 à 10 ans. Elle gère une boutique dans son quartier où elle vend des denrées de première nécessité : riz, sucre, huile, thé vert etc. Elle s’approvisionne au prés de grossiste au marché central  pour la revente dans sa boutique avec l’appui de son jeune frère.

Avec le prêt elle va acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons d’épices et 02 sacs d’ognons.

Les bénéfices vont servir à achever les travaux de construction de l’habitat familiale et de supporter les frais de scolarité des enfants, de soins de santé, la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was inaugurated on the 15th of May 2009. The female members all come from the same district and are all blood relations or colleagues. They are very supportive of each other and are principally small retailers.

Aissatou (standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is a widow and is raising her two boys, aged 7 and 10. She runs a local shop in which she sells basic foodstuffs: rice, sugar, oil, green tea, etc. She gets the supplies for her shop, with the help of her younger brother, from wholesalers at the central market. She will use this loan to buy 10 bags of rice, 5 cans of oil, 10 boxes of spices and 2 bags of onions. Her profits will be used to finish off the construction work on the family home and spent on her children's education, health care and food needs.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of rice, 5 cans of oil, 10 boxes of spices and 2 bags of onions.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 35 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 5 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, 35, is an entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead.  He does not let life's obstacles stand in the way of reaching all his goals and dreams.  He has three children.  The eldest helps with the household economy and the youngest two are excellent students at the community school.

He earns a living growing bananas in the community where he lives.  It is a trade he learned from his parents five years ago.  He sells his produce at market and in neighboring communities to earn an income to improve his family's living conditions.

The loan will be used for banana crop maintenance since it is very important to produce top quality fruit in order to keep the customers he has.

One of his greatest hopes is to plant more banana trees and to see his children finish their education and have professional careers.

loans.use: To pay for banana crop maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, María vive junto a su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mas frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 52, is a very hard-working, responsible person who dedicates all her time to her business.  She lives with her daughter in her own home and has been selling fruit and vegetables for 15 years.  Her stand is in the municipal market near her home.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Manuel Gabino

texts.es:
Manuel de 75 años de edad, es un señor muy responsable y trabajador. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, hortalizas y granos agroindustriales. En su casa vive solo, aunque esta pensando en buscar una compañera de vida para no estar solo, ya que sus hijos viven en familias aparte.

Manuel se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cosechando granos básicos, agroindustriales y hortalizas. Este año ha cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, 14,000 de maíz y una tarea de arroz, los beneficios que tiene es que su cultivo lo tiene cerca, esto hace que se le facilite el manejo de todos sus cultivos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar una parte de mano de obra, para el manejo de pos-cosecha de sus cultivos, ya que se acerca la época de sacar los cultivos y hay que invertir en la cosecha y en guardar los granos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 75, is a very responsible, hard-working man who grows basic grains, vegetables and agroindustrial grain.  He lives alone although he is thinking about looking for a partner, since his children live with their respective families.

This year Manuel has cultivated 7,000 square meters of beans, 14,000 of corn and 630 of rice.  The advantage he has is that his cropland is near so this makes it easy to manage all the crops.

The loan he is requesting is to pay labor costs for the post-harvest activity.  Harvest and grain storage season is approaching and requires investment.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for post-harvest activity.

loans.name: Santos Consuelo

texts.es: Doña santos tiene 62 años de edad y  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 30 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, Doña Santos  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos, 62, lives in her own house with her family.  She sells personal care products and has been in business for 30 years.  She has a stall at the municipal market where she attends to many customers because of her low prices and quality products.  

Santos is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. wholesale so she can continue her work and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Michelle has been in this business for four years now.

Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Marta

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 7 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, adicional a eso también vende tortillas, Doña Ana  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana lives in her own home with her family group. She has had a little store in her house for 7 years. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and her friendliness when she sells. She also sells tortillas. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc. This way, she can have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Tito Santos

texts.es: Don Tito de 49 años de edad viven casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tito is 49 years old. He lives with his wife in his own house. He has worked for ten years making trips on his pick up truck. He has many customers who prefer him for how responsible he is while driving. With what he earns from his job he is able to pay for his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy tires and give maintenance to his vehicle, because it is his only source of work. This way he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and give maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Reyna Gloria

texts.es: Reyna de 43 años de edad es madre soltera  vive en casa propia con su hija, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente desea comprar mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Reyna is 43 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her mother. She has had a food stall close to her home for several years. With her profits she is able to pay for her household expenses. She wants to buy more ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and have a little more income. She doesn't have enough income now to make the investment, and that is why she approached INTEGRAL to ask for a loan and be able to make the purchases and thus obtain better profits to have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es:
Bladimir es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 19 años y vive en Parcona junto a su familia. No pudo estudiar una profesión debido a que la economía en su casa no era muy buena y es por ello que para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar empezó a trabajar como chofer de taxi, él cree que le va muy bien por su buen desempeño, siempre respeta las señales de tránsito y se preocupa por el bienestar de sus pasajeros.
Bladimir está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, de esta manera podrá disfrutar junto a su familia de gratos momentos y así fortalecer su unión. Más adelante tiene como sueño poder comprarse su propio carro y empezar a estudiar una carrera superior.
texts.en:
Bladimir is a young man who really wants to get ahead. He is 19 years old and lives in Parcona with his family. He wasn't able to go to college due to the finances in his home. They weren't very good and he had to help pay for the household expenses. He started to work as a taxi driver. He believes that it is going well for him due to his hard work. He always respects the traffic laws and cares for his passengers' well being.
 
Bladimir is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given he will be able to buy a television for his house. This way, he can enjoy nice moments with his family and strengthen their bond. In the future, his dream is to be able to buy his own car and go to college.

loans.use: to buy a television for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 61 years old and married with six children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks and cooking oil to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ingrid Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad residente en su comunidad, soltera con un hijo de 11 años que se dedica a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven cursando cuarto primaria,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia.

La actividad que realiza ella es la venta de ropa típica ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de refacciones, siempre tratando la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al préstamo que realiza es para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
She is an enterprising woman. She is 31 years old and lives where she was born. She is single and has an 11-year-old son who goes to the local primary school. She has to work hard in order to support her family and improve their economy.

She sells traditional clothes. This is an important source of income for her family and helps her to improve their living conditions. She also sells meals and is always looking for ways to increase her income in order to give her son the education he deserves so that he can become a professional in the future.

She will use this loan to buy traditional clothes to sell them to neighbors and other members of her community. This will result in more income for her and for her family. One of her goals for the future is to buy an establishment where she can sell her clothes. She wants to see her son grow and become a professional, so that he can live a good life.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and be able to serve more customers.

loans.name: Ana Emilou

texts.en:
Ana Emilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Ana Emilou requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Ana Emilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chirly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Chirly works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Chirly is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her ready-to-wear business.

Chirly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.en:
Khusrav is a kind man. He was born in the year 1994. Khusrav is a student of the third course at Tajikistan National University. He is a student of the faculty of Economy and Management. He studies Marketing. 

Khusrav is a very ambitious and hardworking student. He has excellent marks. Khusrav is not married and lives with his parents. Khusrav is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition because his parents do not have the ability to pay for his tuition. They are workers. Khusrav in advance thanks Kiva lenders for mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and has one kid who is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest expense is food. 

Mwanasiti has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000,  she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, married to Painito, and blessed with three school-going children.  Martha has been selling second-hand clothes for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of second-hand clothes to sell. 

Martha will put the anticipated profits back into her business. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, be stable in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Joedy

texts.en:
Fishing has been Joedy's main livelihood for many years now. Being near the sea, this is a common source of income in this place. 

Joedy is asking for a loan to buy rope, nylon, fishing nets, bamboo, a boat propeller, fishing weights and floaters that are necessary for successful and productive fishing. He hopes to have a more profitable fishing business so he can support the needs of his children - two daughters aged four and six. 

Joedy is a married man and his wife has made a sacrifice by leaving the country in order to work abroad for a living and to help him in giving their children a good life. 

In the future, he hopes to expand and to have a better business so that his wife can come home and be with them and his family can be complete.

loans.use: to buy rope, nylon, fishing nets, bamboo, a boat propeller, fishing weights and floaters

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with seven children, living in a five-room house in Bamenda, a region in northwestern Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in life, among which are the deaths of her son and her sister, her ill health, and thieves breaking into her store.

With this requested loan, she will buy two bags of koki beans, three containers of palm oil, firewood, plantain, and other ingredients.

She holds a positive thinking about this business succeeding because she has steady customers and good knowledge about and experience in the business, she has been faithful in her business, and she prepares good food. This business will help her community because she buys from the farmers of that locality, she sells at low prices, and she supplies to customers at their doors and even in schools.

The profit she will realize from this business will help her in paying her children’s fees, paying her bills, and catering for her family's needs. She prefers a GHAPE loan because they charge low interest rates, enough time is allocated for repayment, training has been done before disbursement of funds, and because of GHAPE's encouragement toward its members.

loans.use: to buy koki beans, palm oil, firewood, plantain, and other ingredients

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa. She sends you her gratitude for your generosity because her previous loan enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business with another loan of 8,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of her tricycle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Teresa wants to add another tricycle unit. She hopes that her transportation business will grow big enough to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Miasnik

texts.en:
Miasnik lives with his family in the nice frontier village of Aknaghbyur in Tavush region. He has two children and both of them are school-aged. 

Once Miasnik had a small business and he used to repair cars in a rented garage. Today, together with his beloved wife, he mainly works in farming and agriculture, though sometimes he still takes orders for car repairing in his own garage near his house. 

He says that now he wants to develop his farming and make it richer with cattle. At the moment he has 2 pigs and 20 chickens on his farm and he manages to sell some meat and eggs, but he has a great desire to enlarge both the quantity and assortment of his products. From his plot of land Miasnik also grows potatoes, which he can sell. 

Miasnik will be very thankful if he is able to buy several piglets and animal fodder for his cattle with the help of this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and animal fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her to provide for their daily needs and cover their expenditures.

She is positive that she can improve her business further if you let her borrow again, to the amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of their utility vehicle, to keep it regularly maintained and in good condition. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family. 

Novie is hoping to expand their house so she can attract more boarders, since she also has a house rental business. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her utility vehicle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rental space for more than 20 years and she earns well from this business. She is planning to extend her rooms so she can improve her profits. 

Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs. She is working hard because she is determined to earn a better income.

To improve her profits, Helen would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the rental space. An amount of 25,000 Philippine pesos could really help her renovate and beautify the place and attract more occupants. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Helen meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental space.

loans.name: Ep Cigurhi Group

texts.fr: Monsieur Mugisho est représentant des enseignants de l’école primaire Cigurhi, une institution éducative présente dans la ville. Agé de 52 ans, il est parent de 8 enfants scolarisés et marié à une couturière. Il a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention. Cet ainsi, qu’il vient de solliciter un crédit pour rehabiliter sa maison. Son objectif est d'offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour sa bonté d’accorder le credit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Mugisho is a representative of the teachers in the Cigurhi primary school in town. He is 52 years old and is the father of eight children, who go to school. He is married to a seamstress.

Mugisho became aware of Hekima's loans for teachers, and so is seeking a loan to build a house. His goal, being the director of the school, is to build lasting classrooms.

He thanks Hekima for their kindness in loaning to teachers.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Bunvikane Group

texts.fr: Namurhobo  est conseillère de la banque villageoise Bunvikane. A 33 ans d’âge, elle est mariée à un commerçant des divers produits et ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont seulement 3 vont à l’école et 2 autres n’ont encore atteint l’âge de scolarité.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché de la place depuis plus de 4ans. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter 4 bidons d’huile de palme et accroitre son entreprise. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien.
texts.en: Namurhobo is a counsellor from the Bunvikane banque villageoise. She is 33 years old and married to a man who sells various products. Together, they have five children, with three of them currently receiving an education while the other two are not yet old enough to go to school. She has been selling her wares from her market stall for over four years. She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase four containers of palm oil so that she can grow her business. She would like to thank Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase four containers of palm oil

loans.name: Tojiboy

texts.en:
Tojiboy is a kind man. He was born in 1957. Tojiboy is married and has three adult children. Tojiboy lives with his family in a rural area. He is a businessman. Tojiboy has worked in animal husbandry for more than 20 years. He has great experience in this field. Tojiboy mainly feeds sheep. His business is the family's main source of income. 

Tojiboy is ill now. He needs your financial support because he must buy medicine for treatment, but he does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy medicine for treatment. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a widow with five children. She lives in a six-room house in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of problems in her life, including the shocking death of her husband as well as the initiation of her daughter in a college and an armed robbery attack.
 
Theresia is very optimistic about the success of her business because she has been doing it for some time now and has been very successful. She has a perfect knowledge of the business, which, together with large special orders from customers, boosts her confidence to succeed.

With this new loan she intends to widely expand her business site and open branches of the restaurant. This will help the entire community by providing constant access to meals, which prevents hunger. 

She prefers to seek a loan through Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment, because of the organization's lower interest rates and its encouraging interval period for repayment.

loans.use: To buy different types of digestive wine, beer, rice, beans and others assorted meals.

loans.name: Electa Napain

texts.en:
Electa Napain is a widow with five children living in a four room house in North West Region of Cameroon. She has had a lot of problems since the death of her husband and father and the mysterious death of her brother. 

With the new business she is starting, she will buy cocoyam, beans, corn, and Irish potatoes to sell. She will also buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. She knows it will succeed because this has been her line of business for a long time. Her activities will help the community by providing food to the entire neighborhood, both raw and cooked.

With the profit from this business, she will pay for her children’s school fees; will rebuild the broken house in her compound; and provide for her family's well-being and health care. She prefers to take her loan from Ghape because the interest is low and the duration of repayment is really, really convenient. Furthermore, the non-financial services offered by management, such as training and social networking

loans.use: to buy cocoyams, beans, corn, Irish potatoes, plantains, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nuevo Jardin Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO JARDIN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, ayudante de albañil, costura de chamarras, venta de carne, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace treinta años, tiempo donde empezó con un pequeño capital de trabajo y con un básico conocimiento, con el pasar del tiempo se especializó los tejidos y mejorar sus productos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra lana por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los consultorios que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Nuevo Jardín Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which María's the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of jobs, including blanket sales, construction assistant, sewing jackets, meat sales, food sales, and cosmetics sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like María.  She said it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she has a business weaving blankets.  She learned the business 30 years ago when she started with a small amount of working capital and a basic knowledge.  Over time she specialized in textiles and improved her products.

The loan María's getting is to increase her merchandise by buying wool wholesale, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors.  After production she'll sell her product in her sales stall.  This job allows her to generate the resources to support her family financially, because she's a widow and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the medical consultations the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Mercedario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tejido de lana, venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de fruta, venta de productos de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nieves es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su madre, ya que desde niña ella ayudaba en el negocio familiar, cuando decide vivir en la ciudad de La paz decide tener un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de verduras por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AMOR DE DIOS” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of ten members, and is directed by a board of directors where señora Nieves is President. The members of the communal bank carry out various businesses, such as: cosmetics sales, wool knitting, groceries sales, vegetable sales, fruit sales, and cleaning products sales.

The loan that they are applying for will benefit small micro businesses of which señora Nieves is a member. She points out that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining after a friend who is a member of the organisation invited her. 

She currently has a vegetable sales business. She explains that she learned this trade from her mother, as she used to help in the family business as a child. When she decided to live in La Paz city, she decided to have her own independent business.

She will use the loan she is applying for to increase her goods by buying vegetables in bulk. She will acquire these from bulk sellers, then sell them at her stall. This work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married with a child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to bulk buy vegetables.

loans.name: Pastoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASTORITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, elaboración de pasteles, venta de api, venta de muebles, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de cosméticos, venta de faldas, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nery es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de api (refresco tradicional); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, ya que desde niña ella trabajaba en su negocio; con el pasar del tiempo y con unos ahorros decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de puesto de venta) que adquirirá del mercado donde comercializa sus productos y posteriormente instalará su negocio en ese establecimiento. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PASTORITAS” communal bank is starting their 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes branch office. It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Nery as President. The businesses of the members are varied amongst them are the sales of fruit, making pastries, selling api (a corn drink), selling furniture, selling electronic products, cosmetic sales, selling skirts and selling jackets.

The loan will help all of these micro-entrepreneurs, one of them being Nery. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago on the invitation of a promoter from the institution who came to visit her in her house. Currently she has a business selling api ( a traditional drink). She says that she learned this business from her aunt as she has worked in this business since she was young. With the passing of time and with some savings she decided to open her own business.

The loan that she is receiving is to increase her working capital ( to buy a sales stand) that she will acquire from the market where she sells her product and then she'll set up her business there. This form of working allows her to support her family economically as she is single and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she liked the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a sales stand.

loans.name: Ismenia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Ismenia de 50 anos viuva e mae de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario 2 sao indepedentes. Ela è operaria agricola na empresa de producao de  banana a mais de 2 anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao, manteiga, amendoim, arroz, caldos, e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ismenia is 50 years old, the mother of 4 children - 2 of whom are in high school and 2 who are already independent. She has been a farmer for the local banana production company for more than 2 years and she's also an informal trader of essential goods.

With this loan she will buy essential products (beans, butter, peanuts, rice, stock and others) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: buy essential products (beans, butter, peanuts, rice, stock and others) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Dinis

texts.pt:
O Sr. Dinis de 29 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è pedreiro na  empresa de criacao de peixe a mais de 5  anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a explorar na sua casa junto com sua esposa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao, manteiga, amendoim, arroz, caldos, e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Mr Dinis is 29 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and 1 who is still too young to go to school. He has been a stonemason at a fishery for more than 5 years and he's also an informal seller of essential products. He sells these products from his home with his wife.

With this loan he will buy essential products (beans, butter, peanuts, rice, stock and others) to increase the volume of his stock.

loans.use: buy essential products (beans, butter, peanuts, rice, stock and others) to increase the volume of his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to establish better pastureland for good summer nutrition for his cattle herd, and in turn get more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Ep Jiwe Group

texts.fr: Le client Ntikabuze est un commerçant, membre d’un groupe de crédits «EP JIWE», âgé de 30 ans, marié à une enseignante. Il est vendeur divers matériels de construction dans les périphéries de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter divers matériels de construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Ainsi, il souhaite avoir son propre habitation . Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Ntikabuze is a shopkeeper and a member of the borrowing group "Ep Jiwe." He is 30 years old and married to a teacher. 

Ntikabuze sells assorted construction supplies in the city surroundings. He is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to invest in his business. He will purchase various construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.) 

In the end, Ntikabuze hopes to have his own home. He thanks Hekima for their support of small business owners who are excluded from the traditional banking model.

loans.use: to purchase various construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Angelina de 52 anos de idade solteira e mae de 2 filhos todos sao independentes. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a explorar no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (arroz, amendoim, feijao manteiga, acucar, cebola, tomate, bolachas e diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao, a dieta alimentar dos seus filhos e aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Angelina is 52 years old and the single mother of 2 children who are independent. She's an informal trader of essential products, an activity she carries out from her commercial establishment located in her home.

With this loan she will buy essential products (rice, peanuts, beans, butter, sugar, onions, tomatoes, biscuits and others) to increase the volume of her business.

Her greatest challenge is to improve her living conditions, the quality of her children's diets and to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: buy essential products (rice, peanuts, beans, butter, sugar, onions, tomatoes, biscuits and others) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Samuel de 25 anos de idade e casado pai de de 1 filha ainda menor vive tambem com a mae que se encontra na sua responsabilidade.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia grossa,porta, pedra, chapas de zinco, ferros, para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorrido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Mr Samuel is 25 years old, married and the father of 1 daughter who is a minor. He is also responsible for his mother who lives with him.

He says that with this loan he will buy coarse sand, a door, sheets of zinc and iron rods to keep going with his building work.

In future he wants to expand his house to offer his family a better home.
He says he commits to being punctual with his repayments and will solicit further loans so he can realise his dreams. He also says he has used his family's savings group in the past [xitique, a common practice in Mozambique] to overcome some difficulties.

loans.use: buy coarse sand, a door, sheets of zinc and iron rods to keep going with his building work

loans.name: Grupo O Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se encuentra el "Grupo O" es un lugar tranquilo tiene mucha vegetación. En otoño aunque las hojas comienzan a secarse, los habitantes saben que también inician las fechas más conmemorativas, la más próxima: el 2 de noviembre en que se recuerda a los difuntos. Los panteones se llenan entonces de flores y veladoras. 

El grupo lo conforma una familia y es su segundo ciclo en VisionFund, ellos están muy contentos y agradecidos porque su préstamo les ayudara a invertir más en sus negocios. Elodio y Valentina invertirán en tienda de abarrotes, Paulina, Natalia y Eleuteria invertirán en la cría de borregos.

Valentina es muy joven, pero muy amable. Inmediatamente se emocionó al saber de las personas que podrían ayudarla “Me interesó mucho el fin de KIVA me gusta que personas de otros países nos conozcan y quieran ayudarnos sin conocernos”. Ella tiene 22 años de edad y está casada con David desde hace un año juntos han formado una familia con un niño pequeño aun no asiste a la escuela.

Desde hace dos año inició una pequeña tienda de abarrotes tan sólo porque tenía planes de formar una familia y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Ahora que ya tiene a su bebé y desea pasar la mayor parte del tiempo con él, también tiene la oportunidad de seguir atendiendo el negocio que está en casa. Con su préstamo comprará productos de abarrotes como leche, pan, huevo, productos enlatados, carnes frías, detergentes, etc. para mejorar la variedad de mercancía. a Valentina le encanta su pequeña tienda pues además está muy cerca de la escuela primaria y todos los días, después de clases los niños corren a comprar dulces. Sin embargo, Valentina también está consciente de que hay un gran número de tiendas en varias calles cercanas, pero ella singue con el entusiasmo de impulsar su tiendita y pronto comenzar a vender verduras en el mismo lugar. Lo que más le gustaría a Valentina es tener su propia casa pues por el momento vive con familiares.

*En la imagen: los integrantes del grupo se encuentran en la plaza de su municipio, Valentina es la mas joven de las mujeres, viste un suéter gris.
texts.en:
The community where "Grupo O" is found is a quiet place with a lot of vegetation. In the fall, although the leaves start to dry out, the inhabitants know that many holidays also begin, the next is November 2 when they remember the dead. The graves fill with flowers and votive candles then. 

The group is made up of one family and is in its second loan cycle with VisionFund. They are very happy and thankful because their loan will help them to invest more in their businesses. Elodio and Valentina will invest in a grocery store, Paulina, Natalia and Eleuterina will invest in raising yearling sheep.

Valentina is very young but she is very friendly. She immediately was thrilled when she found out that people could help her. "I was very interested in KIVA's goal. I like that people in other countries can get to know us and want to help us without meeting us."  She is 22 years old and has been married to David for a year. Together, they form a family with a young child who doesn't go to school yet.

Two years ago, she opened a small grocery store just because she had plans of having a family and to help with the household expenses. Now that she has her baby and wants to spend most of the time with him, she also has the opportunity to continue taking care of this business which is in her house. With the loan, she will purchase groceries such as milk, bread, eggs, canned products, cold meat, detergents, etc. to improve the variety of merchandise. Valentina loves her little store since it is also very close to a primary school and every day, after school, the children run to buy candies. However, Valentina is very aware that there are many stores in the nearby streets, but she continues with enthusiasm to boost her store and soon will start to sell vegetables in the same place. What Valentina would like most is to have her own house because at the moment she lives with relatives.

*In the picture: the group members are in the municipal plaza. Valentina is the youngest of the women, she is wearing a grey sweater.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as milk, bread, eggs, canned products, cold meats, detergents, etc.

location.town: Rancheria de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Grupo De Cuachinup Sector La Alcaldia Group

texts.es:
Pedro cuenta con dos hijos: el primero de 6 años de edad y es estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad, el segundo de 3 años de edad  que aun no estudia, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. (Pedro es la que se encuentra de 1ro de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

El se ha convertido en un claro ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a emprender el negocio junto con el para poder satisfacer sus necesidades. La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro has two children.  The first one is six years old and attends school in his community.  The second one is three years old and does not yet go to school.  Pedro is an enterprising man.  It does not matter to him what work he does.  Rather, the only thing that matters to him is to have an income to benefit his family.  (Pedro is the first one of the right in the photo.)

His business activity with which he generates income is buying and selling typical clothing in his community.  It is the only way that he has been able to find to be able to have income for his family.  His second business activity is serving as a day worker in his community.  Through this business activity he is able to have an extra income to be able to support his family and give his children adequate living conditions.  He wants his children to become good professionals in the work force.

He is very enterprising.  That is why he decided to take out a loan to buy typical clothing to have on hand.  He wants to have more merchandise to sell to his customers.

He has become a prime example in his community.  That is why a group of women decided to undertake the business with him in order to be able to meet their needs.  His most important aspiration is to build a better house and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing.

loans.name: Suabo

texts.pt:
O senhor Suabo de 34 anos de idade e funcionario publico, casado pai  de 3 filhos dos quais 1 no ensino primario 2 ainda menores vive na casa dos servicos.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco, ferros,blocos,porta,janelas para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro terminar sua casa, construir uma casa de 2 pisos para oferecer um lar melhor a familia.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Mr Suabo is 34 years old and a civil servant. He's married and the father of 3 children, 1 of whom is in primary school and the other 2 are still too young to do so. They live in a house lent to them by the state.
He says that with this loan he will buy sand, stone, sheets of zine, iron rods, bricks, a door and windows to continue building his own house.

His projects for the future are to finish building his house and build a 2 storey house to offer his family a better loan.

He says he commits to being punctual with his repayments and that he will solicit further loans to make his dreams a reality. He has also used money from his family's savings group [xitique initiatives, a common practice in Mozambique] in the past to overcome some hardships.

loans.use: will buy sand, stone, sheets of zine, iron rods, bricks, a door and windows to continue building his own house.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa está conformado por personas muy responsables y trabajadores. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron por la patrona de su pueblo, una de las vírgenes mas celebradas en la región donde viven.

Rosa tiene 37 años de edad esta casada desde hace 17 años con Ismael quien trabaja como promotor comunitario (dando capacitaciones a personas de la comunidad para sus huertos) juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos los cuales aún asisten a la escuela.

Desde hace 3 años Rosa se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de pavos que compra desde pequeños y los cuida durante algunos meses antes de venderlos. En algún momento llegó a tener hasta 150 animales y ahora está trabajando para incluso sobrepasar ese número por lo que quiere invertir su préstamo para comprar más pavos. Su gran meta es seguir ayudando con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Manuela, Patricia y Norma quien invertirá en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, MartINA, Lucia, Alejandro y Elizabeth ellos invertiran en la cria de los borregos, José Luis en juegos piroctecnicos. La foto fue tomada debajo del quiosco del municipio.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa group is made up of very responsible and hard-working people. They chose the name of the group for the patron saint of their town, one of the holy virgins most celebrated in the region where they live.

Rosa is 37 years old, and has been married for 17 years to Ismael who works as a community promoter (training people in the community about their orchards). Together, they have formed a family with four children who still go to school. 

For the past 3 years, Rosa has worked raising and fattening turkeys that she purchases when they are small and then she cares for them for some months before selling them. At one point she had up to 150 animals and now she is working to have even more than this number, so she wants to invest her loan in purchasing more turkeys. Her biggest goal is to continue helping with the household expenses and her children's education. 

The other members of the group are: Manuela, Patricia, and Norma who will invest in a small grocery store, Martina, Lucia, Alejandro and Elizabeth who will invest in raising yearling sheep, and José Luis in fireworks. The photo was taken below the city kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase turkeys.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cheese, oil, beans, chorizo, chiles, vegetables, bread, disposable plates and napkins.

loans.name: Salem (1) Group

texts.en:
At 24 years old, Getha has plans far beyond her years. After finishing her studies two years ago, Getha was unable to find work in the public sector and so created her own small business selling everything from used clothing to sandals, rice and beans.  The middle of the month has always been the most difficult time for her business, when stock begins to run out. Recently Getha heard about HOPE Congo, and joined the community bank group SALEM (1). 

As the leader of a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs who live and work in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, Getha would like to take out a small loan of 150,000 CFA. 

With this additional money, Getha will be able to purchase additional merchandise for her market stall, such sandals and bundles of used clothing. Business-savvy, Getha branched out from just used clothing to some food items as well to help her maintain an income in the slow times. 

In the future, she hopes to become a high school teacher and use her degree. She plans to keep running a small business on the side, and hiring someone to work for her while she teaches. For her three-year-old son, Getha dreams of being able to send him to study in other countries so that he may one day come back to Brazzaville and work as a magistrate.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her market stall, such sandals and bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Salem (2) Group

texts.en:
Dharline is a member of the community bank group SALEM (2), where she helps lead a subgroup of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. To help support her family, including two children, Dharline runs a small business in the market selling bread and sandwiches to passersby. While the business often requires her to work long hours, Dharline has learned the key times to be in the market, and who to appeal to: school children! Students stop by on their way to school and during lunch breaks to buy a sandwich from her. In order to keep attracting clients, Dharline also tries to diversify the sandwich ingredients she offers. 

Now that she is a member of SALEM (2) with HOPE Congo, Dharline hopes to take out a loan of 200,000 CFA to invest in her business. With this loan, Dharline will be able to buy additional merchandise for her sandwiches such as bread, butter, sausages, peanut butter and more. 

Dharline dreams of having her own snack shop and one day becoming well-known in her neighborhood. She also hopes that her children will be able to finish school and go farther than where she currently is.

loans.use: to purchase bread, butter, sausages and other toppings for the sandwiches she sells

loans.name: Rhema (1) Group

texts.en:
Armande has been running a market stall selling various groceries and toiletries in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo for as long as she can remember. The proud single mother of four children, three of whom are currently in school, Armande is an experienced businesswoman. At her market stall, she sells items such as home-made peanut butter, vegetable oil, onions, and soap. 

Armande recently heard about HOPE Congo and decided to join the community bank ground RHEMA (1). Leading a small subgroup of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs, Armande would like to take out her first loan with HOPE Congo. Armande hopes to take out a loan of 250,000 CFA to invest in her stall. With this money Armande will be able to purchase more diverse items and supplement her old stock with goods such as spaghetti, soap, and salt. 

In order to be more competitive in the market, Armande lowers her prices in relation to that of other people. She also draws in clients by giving out gifts to loyal customers. Armande plans to open a proper grocery store in the future that also sells drinks to customers walking by on the street. She dreams of her children finishing school and one day being able to buy a car or travel to another country.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her market stall, such as spaghetti, soap, and salt

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Her children are non-adults. She is a hardworking business lady. Seven years ago,  Muhabbat started a business deal with buying and selling shoes. At first she sold shoes in a small table in a local market. Little by little, she developed her business. Now she has her own shop where she sells different shoes. 

Muhabbat is going to buy boots for the winter season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy shoes for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fleece material and waterproof material (baby wear) for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rhema (2) Group

texts.en:
Brejnev is the proud father of two children, ages 2 and 5, and the equally proud owner of his own barber shop. For over 10 years, Brejnev has been running his neighborhood barber shop, gradually gaining a reputation of being an extremely qualified and professional barber. People now come from different neighborhoods purely for his services. One of the biggest difficulties with running a barbershop in Brazzaville, the Republic of  Congo, is the lack of stable power. Brejnev has planned ahead however, and hopes to be able to purchase a generator in the next year to have a consistent source of electricity. Brejnev hopes to be able to do this as part of HOPE Congo with the community bank group RHEMA (2). 

As a member of RHEMA (2) and the leader of a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs, Brejnev wants to take out a small loan of 250,000 CFA. With this loan, Brejnev will be able to restock hair products such as powder and electric hair clippers. 

Brejnev is a savvy businessman, and says his strategy to draw in clients is to always be welcoming, and to do sales during holidays like Christmas. 

In the future, Brejnev dreams of being able to have his own modern barbershop with electricity, air conditioning, and a wide arrange of hair styling tools. He also hopes to diversify his business activities to launch into the taxi business. For himself and his family, he hopes to be able to build his own home and that his young children will finish school well.

loans.use: to restock hair products such as powder and to purchase electric hair clippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings, rings and shoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is single with three children. They live in a three room house in Bamenda of the North West Region in Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life and so this has hindered her a lot. These range from deaths, sickness, ill health, and poor sales. The new loan will be for the rearing of poultry, to  buy pigs, raw food items like rice, beans, and corn, feed, and fertilizer, and to restructure a pig fence. She is so optimistic that she will succeed because she has run the business for quite some time. The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have ready food at cheaper prices.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the farm, raise the standard of family well-being, and provide for her children's school fees. Loans from GHAPE are given out at very low interest rates. GHAPE also teaches how to manage capital in business for success. Borrowers also benefit from the ideas exchanged through weekly and monthly meetings.

loans.use: to buy pigs, raw food items like rice, beans, and corn, feed, and fertilizer and to restructure a pig fence.

loans.name: Raheal

texts.en:
Raheal is married and has five children living in a nine room house at Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She hates thinking about the death of her daughter, sickness, and the attack by robbers. She is very confident that her business will be successful because she has perfect knowledge about her little trading business and because of booming sales during Christmas and the strategic location of her business.

The loan will be used to purchase dresses, shoes, fowl, feed, and seedlings like high grade corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams. The community will benefit by buying dresses, shoes and raw food items after harvest at cheaper prices.

With the profit from the business, she will be able to expand her business, educate her children in school, look after her health situation, and also cater to the needs of the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates and a new loan can be given as soon as an old one is finished.  This is coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services like training and social networking.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, shoes, fowl, feed, and seedlings like high grade corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow with four children. They live in a two room house at Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has been faced with a lot of challenges in life, including sicknesses, death, poverty and ignorance. In spite of these, she is still hopeful that business will give a good kick.

She intends to use the loan to buy meat and fish to roast and sell and to buy vegetable oil, more plates and chairs. The community will benefit from this activity by improving their body minerals like protein, fat and oil.

With the profit from the loan, she will be able to pay the children’s school fees, take good care of family needs and the children, and take care of health. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is moderate. She pays back in installments and the duration of repayment is encouraging. This is coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services like training and social networking.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetable oil, plates and chairs.

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CD’s, venta de coca, venta de verduras, venta de futas, venta de cosméticos, venta de cotillones, venta de escobas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yda es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su madre, ya que desde niña ella ayudaba en el negocio familiar, cuando se casó decide tener un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de coca por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica una cliente ausente, la misa se encuentra en el consultorio médico por lo que no estuvo en el momento de la imagen.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Dios" is beginning its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors where Yda is the president. 

The members have a variety of businesses, including selling CDs, selling coca, selling vegetables, selling fruit, selling cosmetics, selling party favors, and selling brooms. 

This loan will benefit women owners of micro-enterprises, Yda being one of them. Yda states that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.
