At present, she has a business selling coca. She shares that she learned this business from her mother, since as a child she helped in the family business. When Yda got married, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that Yda is taking now is to increase her merchandise (wholesale purchase of coca), which she will acquire from wholesale vendors. She will then sell from her market stall. This type of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Yda answered that she likes the training offered by the institution.

In the photo above a member of the group is missing who was at the time at the doctor's office, and therefore unavailable for the picture.

loans.use: to buy coca at wholesale.

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.en: Ohunjon is an entrepreneur person who is married. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 4 years. Little by little with the passing of the time, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the animals good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. He has now 2 cows and 1 horse. Ohunjon is looking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a cow for increasing working capital. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a cow for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
A year and a half ago, Godefroid started up his own business selling clothing in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Selling in front of his home, Godefroid sells both men's and women’s clothes, including traditional Congolese fabric. Newly married with a baby on the way, Godefroid is looking to increase his income to support his family. In 2013, Godefroid joined HOPE Congo and became a member of the community bank group Jehovah Jireh 2 (1). Now on his fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Godefroid leads a subgroup of four other micro-entrepreneurs. 

Godefroid would like to take out a loan of 550,000 CFA through his community bank group to invest in his stand. With this money, Godefroid will be able to purchase additional clothes including men’s suits and pagne, traditional Congolese fabric. In order to get the edge over other clothing stores, Godefroid is able to offer clothing on credit through his stand. This allows him to draw in additional customers that might not have the funds to pay all at once, but can gradually pay him back. One day, Godefroid would like to move into the import-export business and travel to other countries to purchase goods to sell in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to purchase additional men's and women's clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Institut Faraja Group

texts.fr: Bushu est un homme d’affaires, membre d’une association de crédits «Institut FARAJA», âgée de 27 ans, célibataire, responsable de ses petits frères et petites sœurs qui tous étudient. Il est vendeuse divers meubles (équipements de maison) dans le centre ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des  meubles (chaises, lits, porte appareils, armoires, matelas, coussins etc.). Ainsi, il souhaite construire une maison et scolariser ses frères et sœurs. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Bushu, age 27, is a business man and a member of Institut Faraja Group. He's unmarried and has to provide for his little brothers and sisters, who all go to school.

He sells various types of furniture in the city center. He's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to expand his business.

He will buy furniture (chairs, beds, shelves, cupboards, mattresses, pillows, etc). He would like to buy a house and cover his brothers and sisters' school expenses.

He thanks Hekima for its support towards small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy chairs, beds, shelves, cupboards, mattresses, pillows, etc

loans.name: El Molino Del Rosal Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de México se conformó un grupo de personas para solicitar a un préstamo a VisionFund. Hermosos paisajes y la hospitalidad de los habitantes es lo que más distingue a esta región. Los integrantes del grupo “El Molino Del Rosal” tienen muchas cosas en común, principalmente  que todos se dedican a vender el tradicional pan de feria.  

Sonriendo  en todo momento, María Luisa comienza a recorrer el tiempo en su memoria. Con más de 40 años de experiencia y al lado de los hornos de pan comenta que todo comenzó porque su esposo se dedicaba a esta actividad desde antes de casados. Ella se dio cuenta de que don Emiliano necesitaba apoyo y que entre los dos sería más fácil salir adelante. “Nadie nace sabiendo” dice María Luisa, “al principio me costó trabajo”, pero su esposo fue paciente al enseñarle todo el arte de hornear pan.

Hoy en día es una actividad familiar, hijos, hijas y nueras se dedican a perseguir  las ferias más importantes de México durante todo el año. “Mi favorita es la de Guanajuato, en noviembre”. Las personas provenientes de todas partes con sus distintas lenguas, tradiciones y colores son lo que encantan a María Luisa y lo que hacen que esta cuidad conocida mundialmente sea su punto de venta predilecto.

Es así que en las noches de fiesta , mexicanos y extranjeros pueden saborear el pan de nuez o de vainilla por sólo $35 pesos. María Luisa quiere prepararse para el próximo  mes y comprar con el préstamo más leche, huevos, harina, nuez y saborizantes artificiales.

Doña Luisa tiene una gran familia: 10 hijos y 15 nietos “estoy orgullosa de ellos” dice emocionada al encontrar la palabra correcta. Sólo una de sus hijas sigue en la escuela y espera poder continuar ayudándole para que  termine de estudiar lo que más le gusta: enfermería. 

En fechas especiales, después de viajar por varios estados vendiendo pan, finalmente Doña Luisa tiene la oportunidad de reunir a hijos y nietos para disfrutar una buena comida, consentir a los más pequeños y seguir guardando recuerdos .

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Fermina, Jaqueline, Cristina y Francisca quienes también necesitan del préstamo para comprar materia prima y hornear más pan.  

*La imagen se tomó en la plaza central del municipio de las integrantes. María Luisa está parada detrás de las demás integrantes.
texts.en:
A group was formed in a community in the state of Mexico in order to request a loan from VisionFund.  Beautiful scenery and the hospitality of its inhabitants is what most distinguishes this region.  The members of the “El Molino Del Rosal” group have many things in common.  Primarily, they all sell the traditional fair bread.  

Smiling all the time, María Luisa starts to go over time in her memory.  With more than 40 years of experience, and being by the bread ovens, she says that it all started because her husband worked in this business activity since before they were married.  She realized that Emiliano needed support, and that it would be easier to get ahead with two of them.  “No one is born knowing,” says María Luisa.  “In the beginning it was difficult.”  However, her husband was patient in teaching her the art of baking bread.

Now it is a family business activity.  Sons, daughter, and daughter-in-law work at following the most important fairs in Mexico during the entire year.  “My favorite is the one in Guanajuato in November.”  The people from everywhere with their different languages, traditions, and colors are what María Luisa loves.  They are what make this city known worldwide as a favorite point of sales.

So it is that on the festival nights Mexicans and foreigners are able to enjoy the nut bread or the vanilla bread for only 35 pesos.  María Luisa wants to prepare for next month.  She will use the loan to buy more milk, eggs, flour, nuts, and artificial flavorings.

Luisa has a big family, 10 children and 15 grandchildren.  “I am proud of them,” she says, moved upon finding the correct words.  Only one of her daughters continues in school, and she hopes to be able to continue supporting her so that she completes her studies in what she likes the most, nursing.

On special dates, after traveling to various states selling bread, Luisa finally has the opportunity to get together with her children and grandchildren to enjoy a good meal, to spoil the littlest ones, and to continue preserving memories.

The other members of the group are Femina, Jaqueline, Crisitina, and Francisca.  They also need the loan to buy raw material and to bake more bread.

The photo was taken in the central plaza of the members’ municipality.  María Luisa is standing behind of the other members.

loans.use: to buy more milk, eggs, flour, nuts, and artificial flavorings.

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Aristophane is a young entrepreneur from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For the last three years, Aristophane has run his own clothing business. In order to improve his business and increase his income, Aristophane joined HOPE Congo in 2011 and became a member of the community bank group Jehovah Jireh 2 (2). Now on his fifth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Aristophane helps lead a subgroup of four other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville. He would like to take out a loan of 550,000 CFA to purchase additional bundles of clothing to sell individually. 

Starting out with just a market stand, Aristophane dreams of one day opening his own clothing shop. Despite his ambitions for his business, what Aristophane truly cares about is being able to provide employment to his sisters so that they are able to bring in an income for their families.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aide Toi (1) Group

texts.en:
Ghislain is a leader. He started his own business this past year selling drinks and various grocery items in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. As the father of two young children, Ghislain wants to keep his children in a good school so that they’re able to go even further in life than he has. In order to help his business grow, Ghislain joined HOPE Congo as a member of the community bank group Aide Toi (1) and would like to take out his very first loan. Helping to organize the group, Ghislain represents a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs like himself who live and work in Brazzaville. 

Ghislain would like to take out a small loan of 250,000 CFA in order to purchase additional containers of sodas, vegetable oil, and canned goods in bulk to sell individually in his shop. While changing market prices are always a challenge, Ghislain’s strategy to keep ahead of the competition is to have a stock of goods and practice careful bookkeeping. His optimism for his business activities is also evident in his call-and-response slogan he uses with all customers, “Congo is rich!” One day Ghislain hopes to employ other members of his community in the shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of sodas, vegetable oil, and canned goods in bulk to sell individually in his shop.

loans.name: Aide Toi (2) Group

texts.en:
Chancel is university student in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. In order to pay for his studies, Chancel started up a small business offering photocopying, printing and scanning services in the market. Having recently heard about HOPE Congo, Chancel joined the community bank group Aide Toi (2) in order to grow his business. Chancel leads a subgroup of ten other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville and wants to take out his first small loan of 250,000 CFA.  

With this loan, Chancel will be able to purchase additional ink cartridges for his printers and will also be able to buy a second photocopying machine to increase his business capacity. In the future, Chancel would like to finish his studies and become a politician so that he can start working for his country. Chancel dreams of being able to make a real impact and change the conditions he sees around him. Through HOPE, Chancel plans to take out an additional loan to supplement his business and also grow his savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional ink cartridges for his printers and a second photocopying machine.

loans.name: Les Femmes Prosperes (1) Group

texts.en:
Christiane is an experienced business woman. When she first joined HOPE Congo in 2012, she made and sold beignets (Congolese fried dough) in the mornings to bring in an income. Now on her seventh loan cycle, Christiane has diversified her business activities to include a small butcher’s shop. With two grandsons to look after at home, Christiane dreams of being able to save up enough to allow her children and grandchildren to travel abroad. As a member of the community bank group Les Femmes Prosperes (1), Christiane leads a subgroup of four other women who are also small business owners in Brazzaville. 

Christiane would like to take out a loan of 550,000 CFA to invest in her butcher’s shop. With this money, she will be able to purchase additional fish, pork, chicken and other meat in bulk. She will also be able to add some more grocery store items like sardines and butter to sell. Eventually, Christiane hopes to purchase an additional refrigerator and a generator to combat Brazzaville's frequent power outages. Christiane’s secret to success? Keep your shop clean and your food good!

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, pork, chicken and other meat in bulk

loans.name: Les Femmes Prosperes (2) Group

texts.en:
For over fifteen years, Regine has worked hard in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, selling smoked, dried and fresh fish. The mother of four and grandmother of three, Regine is no stranger to having a lot on her plate. In order to help her business expand and better support her family, Regine joined HOPE Congo in 2011. A member of the community bank group Les Femmes Prosperes (2), Regine leads a subgroup of four other micro-entrepreneurs who work in Brazzaville. 

Now on her seventh loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Regine would like to take out a loan of 750,000 CFA to purchase fish in bulk from Pointe Noire, a coastal city in the Republic of Congo. With this money Regine will have enough fish in stock for the holiday season when there is the greatest demand.  Known around her neighborhood for the quality of her prepared fish, Regine strategically places herself just outside the market to sell to people doing their shopping. In the future Regine hopes to employ multiple people in her neighborhood to sell her fish. One day she dreams of opening up a depot to sell fish in bulk and saving up enough to help her children travel.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg (D) Group

texts.en:
Urmila is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Koraput District of Odisha state, India. 

Urmila is a tailor. She currently runs her business from her family’s front porch because she cannot afford to rent office space. Urmila supports her family through her business. She is the only earning person in her family as she got married at very young stage and now her husband's age is not allowing him to do any work. She has faced much trouble in her small life and now she wants to save some money for her children's education. 

Urmila is requesting a loan from Kiva through People's Forum to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business. As a result of receiving the loan, she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living and send her children to school.

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities and they each will use their loan portion for their activity.

loans.use: to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bishano est commerçante, trésorière d’un collectif d’affaires «Toka Chini», âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants dont 8 étudient et 2 sont mariés. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Son conjoint est chômeur. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Ms. Bishano, age 46, is a merchant and the treasurer of Toka Chini Group. She's married and the mother of ten children, out of whom eight attend school and two are married.

She sells food products that she displays in one of the city's market. She started her business with money she got from her family. Her husband is unemployed.

She's been running this business for the past 12 years. This new loan will be used to buy two sacks of tapioca. This way, she wishes to buy food and clothes for her children, and cover their school expenses.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of tapioca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods for her juice bar

loans.name: Satya Sai Shg Group

texts.en:
Ratna is a mother with one daughter. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She is living with her husband. Her husband is always ill and but sometimes he helps Ratna in her business. Her daughter got married this May.  

She joined this group this year to get training from People's Forum and to get a loan also.

Ratna operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. With her loan portion of 15,000 INR, she wants to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing and expanding a vegetable vending business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Bhabani is 27 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is from a family whose family members are suffering from a progressive disease. 

Bhabani has a food making and selling (foods such as bada, samosa, idli, upma, etc) business in the Mayurbhanj market near her house. She, along with her group, has requested this loan through People's Forum to invest in their respective businesses as all are engaged in different business activities. She will use her portion to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Bhabani has been in this business for six years. In the future, Bhabani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Les Amis Fideles Group

texts.fr: Mamy est commerçante, présidente du groupe  d’affaires «Les Amis Fideles», âgée de 32 ans, veuve, mère de 2 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 10 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle, scolariser, nourrir et vetir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mamy is a shopkeeper and the president of the borrowing group "Les Amis Fideles" ("The Faithful Friends.") She is 32 years old, a widow, and the mother of 2 children who attend school.

Mamy had been selling used shoes at the market downtown for 10 years before she requested a loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. She will purchase 10 bundles of shoes to grow her business.

Mamy began her business with funds received from her husband. In the future, she plans to buy some land, and educate, feed, and clothe her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima for their support to small business owners not eligible for traditional banking models.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bundles of shoes

loans.name: Puruneswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Puruneswar is an SHG organized and promoted by People's Forum. This group is situated at a small village of the Mayurbhanj district of Odisha. At present there are 10 members in the group and all of them are very active and very interested in SHG activities. 

Nirupama is a member of this group. She wanted to start a small business to support her family, as she belongs to a very poor family where she has hardly any savings. Her family income was a mere 4,000 INR per month, which was not sufficient to survive her life. But after associating with the SHG, she started saving regularly and got into a food business, so that she can contribute some financial support to reduce the poverty level of her family and increase their standard of living.  

She started cooking food and selling it from her home. She was encouraged by the demand for her tasty food from neighbors. Also, she has a very good relationship with her customers because she cares about the quality and also wants to satisfy her customers' demands. 

Day by day, her customers are increasing, but she does not have proper resources to expand her business, so she thought of putting up a shade and also she wanted to buy some utensils. For that, she has requested a loan to increase her business activity.

loans.use: to put up a shade and to buy some utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Narishakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Saraswati, along with nine other women, is a member of Narishakti SHG, which is situated at Sanaraikali village of the Mayurbhanj district, Odisha. 

She is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children. Her husband is a daily wage labourer and his income is not sufficient to run her family. 

She is just a housewife, but she has a skill of stitching, and she used to stitch when she was unmarried. She wants to buy a sewing machine so that she has requested  a loan amount to get that. Through tailoring, she wants to improve her way of living and also wants to send her children to school. She wants her children to be educated and has a desire to live a peaceful life.

All the members of this group are very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and related materials.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
De 59 años de edad  casado que cuenta con 10 hijos residentes en Sacatepéquez siendo los 5 hijos independientes que cuentan con sus familias propias y los cinco últimos estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad por los cuales tiene ese deseo de superarse.  

La actividad que dignamente desempeña para poder obtener ingresos y ganancias económicas es la realización de compra de abarrotería y venta de productos de abarrotería que se encuentra ubicado en su comunidad, eligió dicha actividad porque a tenido la oportunidad  de haber trabajado 25 años en dicha actividad y que si deja buena ganancia económica.

El motivo principal de la realización del préstamo es para poder comprar productos de abarrotería para poder obtener un ingreso económico y así mismo el ingreso de las ganancias para mantener un sistema económico y apoyar el desarrollo de su comunidad y la de su familia.

Sus metas personales en la vida y en los años próximos es obtener ganancias que estima de su negocio y en ampliar su negocio en la compra de más locales en el centro de su comunidad y en darles una educación mejor a sus hijos para que lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
This man is 59 years old and married. He has ten children who live in Sacatepéquez; five are independent and five go to a nearby school. His children are his motivation to get ahead. He works, proudly, buying and selling groceries in order to generate an income. He works where he lives and chose this activity because he has a 25-year experience and knows that it is profitable.

The main reason to request this loan is to buy groceries to sell and receive an income. With the profits, he will be able to reach financial stability and contribute to the development of his community and his family.

His personal goals for the future are to make good profits and expand his business by buying more establishments in a central location. He also wants to give his children a good education so they can become good professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran  is 52 years old. She is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and resale with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is 54 years old. She is a married woman. She has two children. 

Hafeez is skilled woman in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn her living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and has requested for a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, needles, etc to fulfill her customers' orders on time. This monetary help can take Hafeez closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames, needles, etc. to fulfill her customers' orders on time.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 50 years old, is a married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His major business is cocoa farming, but he is also a government worker. He is a very hardworking man who loves his work and wants to educate his children, despite the challenge of delayed salary payment. He started farming to earn a living and look after his family.

He wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mwamrandu

texts.en:
Mwamrandu is a married man and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mwamrandu has operated a tailoring business for the past nine years. He makes women's suits and men's suits. His potential clients are ladies and gents, and he dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling cosmetics to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall, selling from home, which earns her another source of income. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. Mwanasiti dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase cosmetics and foodstuffs for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman who has five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of one child who is still young. She owns a house that had neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 40-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalo for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
Zanib is 47 years old; she is a married woman.  

She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 60,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 45 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more animals to inflate her sales, and earnings alongside that.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 26 years old and a married woman. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Asma fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more animals for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: take care of his cacao crops

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own house rental business for years and she earns a good amount from this. She works hard to provide for the needs of her children and grandchildren. She is still working hard, despite her age, because she is determined to have a better income.

To improve her profit, Angelina would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of her boarding house. An amount of 30,000 PHP would help her in the renovation and beautification of her place so that she could attract more boarders. Angelina wants to have more rooms to offer to room occupants.  She will also utilize the loan for her food-vending business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rooms for rent.

loans.name: Mario Elias

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario del mismo, este Cantón es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su variedad de flora y fauna silvestre. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio Mario, un joven luchador de 27 años es padre soltero tiene una hija de 4 años a la que ve pocos días a la semana por eso cada que puede aprovecha al máximo para compartir con su hija. 
El vive y tiene su negocio en el recinto la Florida trabaja diariamente un promedio de 10 horas entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene en una gasolinera del sector, este préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio en arreglo y ampliación de las chancheras. 
El Señor Mario se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de este negocio con la familia este negocio le ha ayudado mucho para darle un buen futuro a su pequeña hija, con la inversión de este crédito mejorara su calidad de vida y el de su familia, Mario agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, a canton with a warm and humid climate, is full of friendly, hardworking people. Traditionally they hold celebrations for the community's anniversary. This canton's a popular tourist attraction because of its variety of wild flora and fauna. 

Mario, 27, lives and runs his business in this canton.  He's a determined young man and the single father of a daughter, 4.  He sees her only a few days a week, so he makes the most of spending time with her whenever he can.

Mario lives and runs his business in the La Florida neighborhood.  Between his business and his job in a local gas station, he works an average of 10 hours a day.  He earns a living raising pigs.  He learned this business from his family, and it has helped him a lot in providing a good future for his young daughter.

He's going to invest the loan in repairing and expanding his pigpens.  This loan will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Mario's grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities they offer.

loans.use: to repair his pigpens, to improve his business, and to give his daughter a better future and have more time and quality with her

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Pamella--a wife, a mother, and a farmer with 10 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Chuka, Kenya, together with her three children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Pamella completed high school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. Through mixed farming, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming, and as she likes to say, “Poultry is close to my heart.” 

Although this humble and ever-smiling mother has been making profits selling poultry, she faces challenges of lack of funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and to expand her poultry farming. She is requesting a loan to buy poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Pamella has enough poultry feed, i.e., maize, to give the poultry energy and enough green grams to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity. 

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo to have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. With the loan, she will improve her living conditions and benefit from the profits. She will also get chicken manure, which will save her a lot of cash that would have been spent on fertilizer. This loan will be a turning point in Pamella’s life as she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mubarkah

texts.en:
Mubarkah is a hardworking, married woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Mubarkah’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Mubarkah has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years now, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently Khursheed has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Nussrat

texts.en:
Nussrat is 48 years old and a married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Nussrat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is 36 years old. She is a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Akbari makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Akbari wishes to utilize part of her revenues for providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a green house and buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
“The joy of farming cannot be understood by those who are not involved in it,” said Roiresem, a farmer and also the featured member of the group, pictured with her hand raised. 

She finds joy in harvesting her own cultivation for consumption and selling them for income generation. She is a multi-tasking woman who manages the household responsibilities, including cooking and household chores, and she also does the cultivation for sustenance. They live in a small village where most of the lands are controlled by the village chief. Her husband is also a cultivator. During the off season, he sustains his family from the daily income he gets from his manual work, including cutting fine woods and bamboos. She has three children who are still in school. 

She had availed herself of a loan from WSDS in the previous year which was used in spring onion cultivation. It helped her in saving some amount for future use, and she also holds a good record in repaying the loan. She was very happy with the loan. 

Now she aspires to do the same for spring onion cultivation. With the Kiva loan, she will buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. She will sell the crops after harvesting, which is a good technique for income generation. She wishes to save some amount for the festive season for family gatherings and celebrations. She is excited and sends her good wishes to the lenders. 

The rest of the group members are active women who came together as a group to help themselves financially. They are engaged in similar activities like farming, weaving and petty shops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Kuyedza Group

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married mother of two children, one of whom is school going. She is a tenant living in a suburb of Harare. Her husband is employed on a part-time basis  and he supports her in running her business with any help that he can provide. She sells hand bags and shoes, restocking from individuals who do bulk imports from Mozambique and South Africa. 

After she received training at Thrive she and her group (Kuyedza) got a loan. She used her portion to purchase more stock and started running a flea market at Machipisa. Her general sales range is $US 900 – $US1500 per month and they peak mostly during end of year festive seasons and agricultural produce sales seasons. 

Marjorie is planning to move into a proper shop beginning of next year. A loan to this group will go a long way in furthering Marjorie’s fight for a decent life.

loans.use: To increase her stock of handbags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: It Is Well Group

texts.en:
Millicent is 45 year old and is a married mother of 3 children. She runs a chicken-rearing business (broilers) at her home in Budiriro, a high density residential area in Harare, Zimbabwe.

She started her business in 2011 with a batch of 50 birds and moved to 100 birds, then 150 birds and is now doing 200 birds in six week cycles. Her fowl runs have a capacity to carry 800 chickens. Millicent mainly sells her produce to vendors, butcheries, canteens as well as individuals. With this business she is managing to cover family expenses for food, thus complementing her husband’s salary who is employed as a general hand at a local firm. 

Millicent is requesting a loan to add more batches to scale up her business to 300 birds per 6 weeks. Her long term plan is to have a plot and start doing her business at large scale.

loans.use: To scale up her poultry business

loans.name: Four Stars Group

texts.en:
Tarisai is a member of the Four Stars group. She is 45 years old married and has 3 children. Tarisai is in the poultry business. She has been doing poultry business for more than 3 years. She started keeping batches of 100 chickens per batch and now keeps batches of 150 to 200 chickens at a time. 

When Tarisai heard about Thrive microfinance she and her business-minded friends formed a group and joined the Thrive programme. Tarisai is appreciative of the training at Thrive, as she got good lessons in record keeping and saving money. With the loan from Thrive, Tarisai wants to further grow her batches and extend her fowl run to have a capacity of up to 500 birds. The growth of her business has enabled her to assist her husband to meet the family needs and educate their children. Tarisai plans to work hard and buy herself a car for easy delivery of her chickens to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her fowl run to accommodate 500 birds.

loans.name: One Love Group

texts.en:
Dingase is the chairperson of the One Love group of Thrive Microfinance. She is a 47 year old woman, married, and has three school going children. She lives in a high density suburb in the Harare province. She buys and sells clothes and is now also into poultry business.

Dingase is actively involved in community development activities. She helps orphanages with fundraising initiatives and also donates clothes to the orphans. Before taking her first loan, she used to concentrate on clothing, selling in the nearby farming communities. When she took her first loan she built a fowl run in her backyard and started broiler rearing. 

Currently she has a hundred birds in her fowl run and is facing the threat of losing her customers to other broiler producers as she usually goes for long periods of time without mature birds to sell. With a Kiva loan, she intends to expand the poultry business so as to stagger the batches at 3 week intervals so that she closes the gap when she cannot supply the demand.

loans.use: To increase her poultry business

loans.name: Arei Group

texts.en:
Here are the group members of Arei, pictured with their beautiful traditional wraparound skirts. Jangneihoi is the featured borrower of the group, pictured with her hand raised. She is 50 years old, a disciplined, skillful and hard-working mother of three whose occupation is farming. She lives in a small village around 23 kilometres from the main town. Her husband is a daily labourer and works hard to meet the family needs. 

Jangneihoi cultivates mustard leaves, cabbages, peas, beans and other seasonal vegetables to sustain her family. She acquires the land from the village chief, a temporary ownership. The village chief has full control over the land. Her husband also helps her with the cultivation during busy seasons. The crops she grows are mainly for household consumption while the surplus production is sold in the market which is also her main source of income. By doing this, she generates income that is spent in buying household requirements and payment of other fees. 

During the off-season, she also weaves traditional garments for income generation. She plays an important role in meeting her family's needs. She wanted to access a loan so that she can buy more saplings and fertilizers for farming. With the Kiva loan, she will buy the desired saplings and fertilizers. She will provide the required household articles and school fees for the children from the income she makes. She also wishes to save some amount from the earnings. 

She is happy to access the loan and sends her thank-you to all the generous lenders. The rest of the group members are engaged in different businesses like petty shopkeeping, weaving, vegetable vendor, poultry, clothing business and rice selling. They are all working hard to achieve their financial goals.

loans.use: To buy saplings and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 53 años se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa interior, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisca, 53 years old, has made a living selling underwear garments for the past years. She sells as a street vendor in various neighborhoods and has gained loyal customers. She lives in her own house with her family.
Francisca is asking for a loan to be able to buy more clothing at wholesale so as to continue her sales and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.en: Fariza is a 43-year-old woman who is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all things. They would like to provide their children with all modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her children more progressive.  Fariza tries to provide them with a better quality of life.  That’s why 2 years ago she began her own business with sewing national women's dresses. She has her own workshop. Thanks to the good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: Kinyabuguma est commerçante, présidente du groupe d’affaires «Uwezo», âgée de 36 ans, mariée à un cambiste,  mère de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits de beauté et de maquillages pour dames dans un magasin de la ville depuis 2 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va  acheter des boites de maquillages, chevelures artificielles, fil de tressages, etc. pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte construire en dur, scolariser, nourrir et vetir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kinyabuguma is a shopkeeper and the president of the borrowing group "Uwezo." She is 36 years old, married to a trader, and the mother of 6 children who all attend school.

Kinyabuguma has sold assorted beauty and makeup products for women in a shop in town for 2 years; now she is requesting a loan through the microfinance organization Hekima. She will purchase makeup cases, artificial hair extensions, braiding threads, etc. in order to grow her business.

Kinyabuguma began this business with funds from her husband. In the future, she plans on building a home and educating, feeding, and clothing her children. In closing, she thanks Hekima for their support of small business owners not eligible for traditional banking.

loans.use: to purchase makeup cases, artificial hair extensions, braiding threads,etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 28 years old. She is single and  blessed with two children of 10 and 6 years of age. 

Brenda runs a food kiosk, a business she has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Brenda has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 20,000 which she will use to purchase cooking ingredients for her food stall. They include rice, cooking oil, vegetables, cereals and onions.

With the anticipated profits, Brenda will be able to live a better life and educate her children to higher levels.

Her hope and dream for the future is to see her children enjoy a good life.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: Kamate est commerçante, membre d’une banque villageoise «Mama Inuka», âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un homme d’affaires, mère de 7 enfants dont 5 étudient et 2 sont gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires depuis 2 ans. Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu d’une institution de la place. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  100 litres d’huiles, 2 paniers de tomates etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente est avec son bébé.
texts.en:
Kamate is a merchant and member of a "banc villageois" loan group named "Mama Inuka". She is 35 years old, married to a businessman, and the mother of seven children, five of whom attend school and two are still kids.

This member has been selling food products for the past two years. She displays her wares at her home in one of the city's busy avenues. She started her business with funds received from a local institution.

This new loan will be used to buy 100 liters of cooking oil, 2 baskets of tomatoes, etc. She wants to increase her working capital, educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima profusely for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs. It should be mentioned that one of the members is holding her baby.

loans.use: buy 100 liters of cooking oil, two baskets of tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is aged 37 years, married with four children and living in Kasese, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labour. Emmanuel has a dream of educating his children to degree level. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Emmanuel  is a man of surprises, who would love to renovate his house as a Christmas gift for his family. He will use the loan facility to buy sand and cement for renovating his house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for renovating his house.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is a married woman. She has five children, all of whom attend school. Mwajuma owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwajuma operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married man and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mangale has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. He makes women's and men's suits. His potential clients are ladies and gents. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, living in Armavir town, is a teacher with 24 years of experience. Besides working at a local school, Mariam provides individual training to students, preparing them for entrance exams. Mariam lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law, who also works at the school.

Mariam's husband owns a truck and provides cargo transportation services for rent. Mariam provides her classes from one of the small rooms in her house. She has applied for this loan to ask lenders to help her with purchasing a computer for providing classes more effectively.
 
Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer for providing classes more effectively

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth was born and raised in Makueni a county in Kenya. He is a carpenter and owns rental structures in Nairobi's Mukuru informal settlements. He is however concerned that his tenants do not have access to proper sanitation facilities and this exposes them to a risk of contracting sanitation related ailments. He is also afraid that he may lose his tenants due to the same issue. Owing to this, he has embarked on a mission to provide for them with proper sanitation. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet. He hopes that the toilet will enable his tenants to lead a more comfortable lifestyle once the facility is installed.

loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a TV to furnish her house.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Noravan village where she lives with her parents. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother takes care of the household. Naira has been working as a hairdresser in a local beauty salon for  13 years already. 

Due to her hard and professional work, Naira was able to gain a good client base, so she also receives her clients in her house. She has now applied for this loan to ask lenders support her work. She needs to purchase hairdressing tools and accessories (dryer, hair iron) needed for her work. 

 Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for hairdressing tools and accessories (dryer, hair iron)

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in the Kampong Cham province, Channy is 34 years old. She is the mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and one is very young. To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. Moreover, she works as a construction worker to earn more income. 

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. Her group has two members and she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year's, and she also wants to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lytheang's Group

texts.en:
Lytheang is 20 years old and married with no kids. To support her family, she grows rice and cassava. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to support the family's needs.

This is Lythean's first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of her group, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, mats, doors and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of flour, cooking fat and rice to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Instit Faraja Group

texts.fr: Le client Shamavu est un commerçant, membre d’un groupe de crédits «Instit Faraja», âgé de 40 ans, marié à une éducatrice, père de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Il est vendeur divers matériaux de construction à l’entrée de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des ciments, fers à béton, briques, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Client Shamavu is a merchant, member of the "Instit Faraja" credit loan group. He is 40 years old, married to a teacher, and the father of three children attending school.

He sells various building materials at the entrance to the city. He is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand his activities. He will buy cement, rebars, bricks, etc. He wants to educate and feed his children.

He thanks Hekima for the support given to small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy cement, rebars, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman, living together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nok

texts.en: Residing in Siemreap province, Nok is 37 years old and a mother of five schoolchildren. She grows rice as her main source of income. She also grows cassava to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 25,800 KHR per day. This is Nok's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy a motorcycle for taking her children to school. She hopes that her children have a good vehicle to use to go to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for taking her children to school

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Noëlla est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire «Zamiri», âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un maçon, mère de 5 enfants  qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché central depuis 10 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperies. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte renforcer ses activités et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
The client Noella is a merchant and member of the "Zamiri" community bank. She is 35 years old, married to a bricklayer, and the mother of five children, all of whom attend school.

She has been selling second-hand clothes at the central market for the past ten years, and is now applying for a loan from the Hekima MFI. She will buy two bales of used clothing. She started out with funds received from her husband.

In the future, she wants to bolster her activities and educate her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to small non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy two bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Amis Fideles L Group

texts.fr: Apollinaire est commerçant, membre du groupe solidaire «Amis Fideles L», client de l’IMF Hekima, marié à une commerçante, âgé de 45 ans, père de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Il commença son business avec de fonds recu après avoir vendu son véhicule. Il est vendeur des divers produits manufacturés et propriétaire d’une boutique dans le centre ville depuis 6 ans. Il va acheter des cartons de biscuits, piles, savon en poudre, huiles, sucre, farines, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Apollinaire is a shopkeeper and a member of the group "Amis Fideles L" ("Faithful Friends L.") Apollinaire is a client of the microfinance organization Hekima and married to another shopkeeper; he is married and the father of 4 children, all of whom attend school.

He began his business with the proceeds from having sold his vehicle. Apollinaire has sold assorted commercial products in a shop downtown for 6 years. He will purchase cartons of biscuits, batteries, powdered soap, oil, sugar, flour, etc. 

In the end, Apollinaire hopes to pay back his loan, educate and feed his children. In closing, he thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs not eligible for traditional banking.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of biscuits, batteries, powdered soap, oil, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Armée Du Salut Group

texts.fr: Maniraguha est une femme d’affaires, membre d’une association de crédits «Armée du salut», âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 8 enfants  dont 4 étudient et 4 n’étudient plus. Elle est vendeuse de divers matériels de construction sur la route secondaire de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 145 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Maniraguha is a businesswoman and a member of a Salvation Army loan association. She is 40 years old, married to a businessman and the mother of eight children, four of whom study and four no longer attend school.

For the past four years she has been selling a variety of construction materials on one of the city's side streets. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her activities, and will buy 145 boards.

She wants to buy a parcel, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy 145 boards

loans.name: Mayra Jackelin

texts.es: Mayra de 25 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su hija de 1 año de edad en la vivienda de sus padres. Ella es una mujer luchadora que todos los días pone todo su empeño en sacar adelante a su pequeña hija prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Mayra desea tener su propia vivienda pero sabe que por sus condiciones económicas no puede realizar una gran inversión como la necesaria para una vivienda, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: vara de castilla, lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir una vivienda de bajareque y lograr así su sueño de tener un lugar propio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 25-year-old single mother, who lives with her daughter of 1 year old at her parents’ house. She is a persistent woman who every day makes her best effort to support her young daughter by offering her domestic services. 

Mayra wishes to have her own house but she knows that due to her financial conditions, is not possible for her to make a big investment in order to obtain one. That is why she has taken the decision of requesting a loan from FUSAI that will allow her to buy: reeds, galvanized sheet, wood and nails. 

With these materials she will be able to build a house of wattle and daub and finally accomplish her dream of having a place of her own to live.

loans.use: to buy: reeds, galvanized sheet, wood and nails, and build her house.

loans.name: Instit.faraja Group

texts.fr: Shemburano est un commerçant, membre d’une plate forme d'affaires «Instit.Faraja», âgé de 50 ans, marié à une commerçante et père de 8 enfants tous étudient. Il est vendeur divers matériels et matériaux de construction à son domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des planches, clous, tôles, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Shemburano is a merchant and a member of the "Instit.Faraja" business association. He is 50 years old, married to a merchant and the father of eight children, all studying.

He sells various hardware and building materials from his home located in a busy avenue.

He is seeking a loan from Hekima to expand his activities, and will buy planks, nails, sheet metal, etc.

He wants to educate, feed and clothe his children. He thanks Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy planks, nails, sheet metal, etc.

loans.name: Ingrid Anayancy

texts.es: Ingrid de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a 30 year old single mother living in her own home with her son. She has been making a living for several years by making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residency and she has a lot of clients. 
She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal and lime, enabling her to continue with the production of the tortillas. This way, she will have better incomes in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn by the quintal and lime

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su madre.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is not shown in the picture for being 25 years old and living at a high-risk area, has a store located at her place of residence. She has a lot of customers due to the variety of her products. 

She lives in a house with her mother, and is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, like: candies, soda pops, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc. This way she will improve her incomes and her quality of life along with her mother.

loans.use: to buy candies, soda pops, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Venh's Group

texts.en: A resident of Battambang province, Venh is 48 years old, and the mother of ten children. She earns income to support her family by growing cassava and rice. She has been involved in this business for many years. This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Rony Alexis

texts.es: Rony de 32  años vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios  años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rony, age 32, lives with his wife and his two children. He has had a bakery located at his place of residence for several years now, and has a lot of customers due the quality of his bread. 

With the earnings that he gets, he manages to pay for the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jellies of different flavors, molds, etc. This will allow him to continue with his work and improve his incomes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jellies of different flavors, molds, etc.

loans.name: Teang's Group

texts.en: Teang, age 47, is a mother of five children, living in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice on one hectare area as her main source of income. She also sells snacks to earn extra income. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have uplifted her lifestyle gradually. In a group of two members, Teang is the leader. With her portion of the loan she will buy seed and pay the plowing fee to support her farming. She hopes that she can improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay the plowing fee to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SOUTOURA  ont en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales, la fabrication de vin. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur 10ème   prêt solidaire. TENIN, 1 ère  femme debout à la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de mils et des bois de chauffage pour la fabrication du vin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group called  Soutoura have an average age of 41 with, on average, 6 children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

 These women met because of being relatives and they all buy and sell diverse products, cereals, or make wine. After having correctly reimbursed their preceding loans, the women from the group called Soutoura are on their 10th solidarity loan. Tenin, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy six sacks of millet and firewood used for manufacturing wine. She buys her supplies right there, from farmers. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often for credit.

Tenin expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make wine

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her grandchild (who is a  student) in Artik town. She is a nurse working at a local school for  20 years already.

Besides her work in the school, Susanna also provides nursing services both in the town and in nearby villages. She organizes visits to her patients' houses and provides various medical services. 

Now Susanna is asking lenders to help her with purchasing needed medical equipment, materials and medicines. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for medical equipment, materials and medicines for providing nursing services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for advanced training in music therapy

loans.name: El Bajo Olivo Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos uno de ocho años y otro de cuatro años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, constante independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, con una temperatura que varía de los 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el Qhechua debido a que sus padres son de occidente (sentada con blusa negra). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte y sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. La necesidad por expandir su negocio y ayudar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos la hizo conformar una banca de personas con ocho integrantes que se dedican a realizar actividades como; venta de mandiles, venta de poleras, confección de polleras, venta de ropa para niños, venta de empanadas,venta de celulares y venta de jugos batidos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Ella se encarga de buscar clientes ubicados en oficinas, centros comerciales, puestos de venta, etc., personas que por sus trabajos no tienen tiempo de salir e ir de compras, y les ofrece productos que lleva en su bolsón y otros que se encuentran en su catálogo, es una labor bastante agotadora por las distancias que debe recorrer y el peso que debe cargar. Su sueño es tener una tienda de cosméticos para vender por mayor y contar con vendedoras que realicen las ventas, su negocio es rentable porque los productos que ofrece son de buenas marcas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y ayudar a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is a 31 year-old woman, who lives with her partner. She has two children, one who is eight years old, and the other is four years old. Her business is selling cosmetics. Juana is of dark complexion, medium height, robust physically, has long black hair; her native language is Spanish and she knows Quechua from her parents who are from the west (Seated in the black shirt). She goes about her life with her husband who works in transportation, and her children. The oldest studies in school, and the youngest is in her care. 

She made a communal bank of eight members who work in various fields because of the need to expand her business and meet the needs of her children. The other members work in selling aprons, shirts, children's clothes, empanadas, cell phones, smoothies, and shirt-making. This is to request a loan and have their businesses prosper. 

Juana's business is selling cosmetics from catalogs. She is in charge of finding clients in offices, malls, kiosks, etc. or people who do not have the time to shop. She offers them products that she carries in her bag and others which can be found in the catalog.
