This is a tiring business because of the distance she needs to travel and the weight she has to carry. Her dream is to have a cosmetics store to sell in bulk and rely on salespeople who will close the sales. Her business is profitable because the she offers well-branded products. This is the first instance of loan with the institution in the year she has been working in this business. She hopes to buy cosmetics in bulk to take advantage of end of year sales and help to satisfy the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk to take advantage of end of year sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in PVC piping, cement, sand, gravel and labor for the construction of a water drainage system in his home.

loans.name: Grotto Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe GROTTO est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10ème prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  de chaussures à l’image de BINTA qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200 paires de chaussures avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Grotto group consists of seven married women who on average are 32 years old with four children. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where they are on their tenth loan. All nine previous loans have been fully repaid.

This group of women trades shoes like Binta,the second woman sitting from right to left in the picture. She intends to use her loan to 200 pairs of shoes from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales in the market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 75,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is married and has two children who attend school. She sells vegetables from a stall at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Airen requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick in order to finish construction on his home

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has seven children.

With a portion of this loan, Margaret will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Margaret plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Margaret’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
VERONICA con 27 años de edad ha tenido momentos en su vida muy difíciles. desde el momento en que era estudiante y se enamoró del padre de su hija (hoy difunto) enfrento junto a su hija la soledad y el dolor de haber perdido a su compañero.
esta tragedia la vivió por 2 ocasiones y hoy se encuentra sola con sus 2 hijas de 7 y 5 años. 
ha luchado por brindar a ellas lo mejor en educación, salud y alimentación.
sus hijas son su razón de ser y le dan el valor de trabajar gracias al apoyo que oportunamente le brindo FODEMI en poner una pequeña tienda con todos los productos que los vecinos y clientes buscan.
VERONICA es clienta de FODEMI desde ya hace un año y desde entonces ha encontrado un apoyo en sus compañeros de grupo quienes también trabajan en beneficio de su comunidad.
ella espera en un futuro poder tener su propia casa ya que por el momento habita en una casa prestada por lo que sus familiares no quisieron apoyarla desde que se embarazó de su segunda niña.
hoy es feliz con sus 2 nenas y espera acompañarlas siempre.
texts.en:
Veronica, 27 years old, has had difficult times in her life. From the time she was a student and fell in love with the father of her child, now deceased, she faced along with her daughter the loneliness and pain of having lost her companion.

She lived through this tragedy twice, and now she is alone with her 2 daughters, aged 5 and 7 years.

She has fought to provide them with the best in education, health, and nutrition.

Her daughters are her purpose in life and they give her the courage to work, thanks to the timely support that FODEMI provided to her for opening a small store with all the products neighbors and customers are looking for.

Veronica has been a FODEMI client for a year, and in that time she has found support in her fellow group members, who also work for the benefit of their community. 

She hopes to have her own house in the future, since at the moment she lives in a borrowed house because her family members refused to help her from the time she became pregnant with her second daughter.

Today she is happy with her two little children and hopes to be with them forever.

loans.use: to stock up on more products such as rice, sugar, brown sugar, soap, oil, eggs, and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year old man. He is married to Monica, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with three children. 

Joseph has been operating a welding shop for ten years, earning an income of KES 15,000 every month. He is requesting his 5th loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 120,000. He intends to use this amount to buy a welding machine.

Joseph plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees to his children and hopes to become a successful man with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Gloria Armida

texts.es:
Gloria de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos a quienes les brinda estudio con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo diario les da el sustento y lo necesario para que sean felices.

Gloria es una mujer alegre que le gusta disfrutar la vida y le da gracias a Dios por cada día que amanece, ella es una mujer emprendedora, que lucha por lo que quiere y cumple lo que se propone a pesar que ella solo estudio hasta tercer grado por dificultades económicas aprendió lo mas básico para poder defenderse.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa ya tiene varios años desempeñándose en esta actividad, ella sale a vender por los cantones y en ocasiones la acompañan sus hijos después de ir  a la escuela. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar blusas, pantalones, short, faldas, ropa interior para hombre y mujer.  así aprovechara la temporada de noviembre y diciembre que es cuando mas vende y obtiene buenos ingresos.

Gloria lo único que pide a Dios, es que le de vida para ver crecer a sus hijos estudiados, profesionales y que le de salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gloria, 47, is a single mother of 3 children who are in school.  With her efforts and daily work, she is providing them with support and with everything they need to be happy.

Gloria is a cheerful woman who enjoys life and gives thanks to God for every day that dawns.  She is an enterprising woman who strives for what she wants, and she accomplishes her goals in spite of the fact that she has only a 3rd grade education, due to financial difficulties.  But she got a basic education so that she could fend for herself.

Gloria has a business selling clothing.  She's been doing this for a number of years.  She goes out to sell in the cantons, and at times her children come with her after school hours.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy blouses, pants, shorts, skirts, and underwear for men and women.  This way she can take advantage of the selling season in November and December, when sales are high and she can obtain good earnings.

Gloria only asks God to live long enough to see her children grow up to become educated professionals, and that He gives her health so that she can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats for roasting to sell.

loans.name: Janipher's Group

texts.en:
Janipher, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in the Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 8 children.

With a portion of this loan, Janipher will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Janipher plans to use the profits she gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total Janipher’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, and a solar light.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom currently attend school. Norah has been operating a stall selling foodstuffs and vegetables in the market, at retail, for one year. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. She lives in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Norah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy tomatoes, vegetables, mangoes, onions, and oranges. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to start farming. She joined MCDT SACCO because the loan interest is relatively low.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, tomatoes, oranges, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Phydillizah

texts.en:
Phydillizah is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan of 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for sale.

loans.name: Timothy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Timothy, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 15 children. He is known by his community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Timothy joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Timothy plans to send his children to school.

Between the 9 farmers in Timothy's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Damaris' Group

texts.en:
Damaris, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in the Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Damaris will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Damaris plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Damaris’ Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and two solar lights.

loans.name: Asmani's Group

texts.en:
Asmani, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He is married and has five children.

With a portion of this loan, Asmani will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Asmani plans to use the profits he gains this year to repair his home.

In total Asmani’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a rural farmer who owns several cows and earns a living by selling their milk. He also sells cereals to supplement the income from milk. When he found out about UGAFODE Microfinance services, he was very interested in applying for this loan to reduce his costs, particularly transport costs that he was incurring by buying in small quanitities.

The purchase of more maize will allow Henry to supply his customers, especially schools, with more corn and at a cheaper price. This will help Henry to increase his profits.

Henry sees the loan as an opportunity to increase his sales and is taking full advantage of it instead of buying less corn, as buying in larger quantities is less expensive. Through this investment, Henry's direct household will become a more pleasant place to live because of the improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a single mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Veronicah operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal to sell, and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal and to pay for transport

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Faith has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge in stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ndela

texts.en:
This is Ndela. She operates a business selling ladies' shoes. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a Kiva loan of 30,000 KES to buy additional women's shoes. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ndela dreams that her children will finish their studies, and she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional women's shoes

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She sells fabric materials, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns a monthly income of 32,000 KES.

Linda requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy more textiles fabric materials for making dresses. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to expand her business and open a school for dressmaking.

loans.use: to purchase textiles fabric materials

loans.name: Lenah's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Lenah, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 5 children. She is known by her community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Lenah joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Lenah plans to invest in a business.

Between the 7 farmers in Lenah's Group, a total of 4 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Dymphina's Group

texts.en:
Dymphina, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 5 children.

With a portion of this loan, Dymphina will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Dymphina plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Dymphina’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and a solar light.

loans.name: Zelefa's Group

texts.en:
Zelefa, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has 7 children.

With a portion of this loan, Zelefa will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Zelefa plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Zelefa’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nivan

texts.en:
Nivan is a 28-year-old married mother of one child. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started preparing special chocolate souvenirs from her house five years ago for special occasions. She helps her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Nivan is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying a special chocolate machine which will facilitate her work and allow her to provide quick and better service for her customers.

Nivan hopes to open her own souvenir shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a special chocolate machine.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32 years. He is married to Caren and together they have been blessed with three children. 

He runs a retail shop, a business he has done for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

Charles has requested for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000, which he will use to buy a stock of retail goods for his shop.

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to live a better life and to educate his children to higher levels.

His hopes and dreams for the future is to always move forward and not look back in his life, family and business.

loans.use: to add a stock of retail goods

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a farmer, and has been in the farming business for 10 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to be successful in her business and to be self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says John, a 44-year-old, mixed-farmer, based in Kaplolo, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. 

John is a proud father of three school-going children whom he truly loves and greatly adores. John describes his upbringing as challenging, so he is doing everything in his power to provide a good foundation for his children and to help secure their future. 

John has been farming for over ten years. Over the years, he has gained much experience and is now considered to be one of the best farmers in his village because of the immense knowledge he possesses. Since he has excess food for dairy cattle and enough space on his land, John has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but his challenge is a lack of finances. 

That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men, like John, to turn their dreams into reality. John believes the loan will help him to satisfy the demand for milk in his area and enable him to realize his dream of developing his business into a large enterprise. 

Many men in Kenya are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family. John wants to provide all of the basic needs that his children and parents require. John is very disciplined with his finances and he knows that, with the accumulated profits, he will be able to fully repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells produce of popcorn and, at the same time, has a pool table business and owns rentals which add a lot of income. He faces challenges of inadequate capital. Yusuf  hopes to complete his commercial houses. Yusuf needs a loan to buy popcorn seeds to sell.

loans.use: to buy popcorn seeds to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen is a taxi driver living in Gyumri town with his parents. He drives a taxi in Gyumri town, which he has been doing for two years. Due to his polite attitude towards his clients, he is able to gain many clients. 

To be prepared for the winter season Vigen requested a loan, which he will use to purchase four tires and renovate the transmission. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase four tires and renovate the transmission

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is from Artik town, where she lives with her retired father. She has been a teacher, working at a local school, for many years. Besides her work in the school, Nune also provides individual classes to her students in her house. 

Nune now asks this loan so she can purchase a computer needed for providing individual classes. This purchase will make her classes more effective, and Nune will be very grateful to lenders for their support. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer for providing individual classes

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Artik town with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (4 and 2 years old). She is a musician working at a local kindergarten, as a part-time worker. After her work there, Astghik provides individual piano classes for children in her house. She is very nice and professional in her work with children, as they fill all her day. 

Astghik applied for this loan to ask for financial support to be able to purchase a computer, printer, musical literature, and accessories needed for providing piano classes to her students. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer, printer, musical literature and accessories needed for providing piano classes.

loans.name: Tendwa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Tendwa, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Tendwa is married and is a father to six children. He is known by his community as a very resourceful person.

Initially, Tendwa joined One Acre Fund in 2010. He wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Tendwa plans to send his children to school.

Among the eight farmers in Tendwa's Group, a total of three acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer they received with this loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will receive a total of four solar lights, in addition to the farm inputs already mentioned.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize. Some members of the group will also buy a solar light.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 20-year-old, single woman, majoring in accounting in her second year. 

Alaa lives with her family of six members in Ajloun. Her father has already retired from the military, so he has only the retirement salary to depend on, which is not enough to support the family and pay for Alaa’s school fees at the same time.

For that, Alaa decided to take a loan, so she won’t have to pause her education process and can pay for the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the semester fees.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, es un grupo que quiere salir adelante es por ello que se ha formado.
La Sra. Verónica pide este préstamo para  la compra de ropas, ya que piensa en salir a vender, de manera a poder implementar esta actividad. Ella quiere comprar remeras, short, pantalones, ropa interior, blusas, calzas; para así tener más ingresos para la casa, ya que ella es enfermera y tiene tiempo para salir a vender por el barrio, y tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The all-female San Juan community bank is embarking on its first round of funding.  All of its members have businesses and are working hard to help their families get ahead.  They started the community bank to support their efforts.
Sra. Veronica is applying for a loan that she will use to start a clothing sales business.  She plans to sell t-shirts, blouses, footwear and other clothing pieces.  She is a nurse but has time for a part-time business and the loan will provide her with the funding she needs to get started.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Fente Allabo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FENTE-ALLABO ont en moyenne 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits cosmétiques, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FENTE-ALLABO sont à leur 17ième   prêt solidaire. NIAYE, 1ère  femme debout à la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 cartons de pommades de crèmes et lotions de différentes variétés. Elle s’approvisionne à San chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 42 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Fente-Allabo group are on average 46 years old with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are active traders of cosmetics, cereals and condiments. Having fully reimbursed their previous loans, the women in the Fente-Allabo group are on their 17th group loan.

Niaye, the first woman standing on the right of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy ten cartons of various ointments, skin creams and lotions. She resupplies from wholesalers in San and conducts her sales to a customer base of women and men, in cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 42,000 CFA francs that will be spent on health, food, clothing, school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen lives in Masis with his parents and brother. He is involved in a delivery and retail business. More specifically, for the last five years, Vigen has been purchasing housing products in large amounts and delivering and reselling them to local stores. Due to his hard and tireless work, Vigen was able to establish good cooperation with many local small and big stores, so he is receiving a large number of orders during the month. 

Vigen has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stocks of housing supplies. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of housing supplies to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Geoffry, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to seven children. He is known by his community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Geoffry joined One Acre Fund in 2011. He wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Geoffry plans to invest in a business.

Among the 15 farmers in Geoffry's Group, a total of 6.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer they received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will receive a total of eight solar lights, in addition to the farm inputs just mentioned.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize. Some members will also buy a solar light.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with his wife, who is a teacher at an orphanage, and their 13-year-old daughter, who attends school. Andranik works day and night to provide his family with appropriate living conditions. His business involves purchasing old cars to either renovate or divide into spare parts to sell to local auto repair services.

Andranik is requesting this loan to purchase two Soviet cars to divide into spare parts to resell. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two Soviet cars to divide into spare parts to resell.

loans.name: El Lindero Group

texts.es:
El Lindero es un grupo ubicado a la orilla de la carretera desde donde se puede apreciar los sembradíos de hule y caña. Muy cerca está el panteón que durante la celebración mexicana del Día de Muertos se llena de color por los arreglos que humildemente cada familiar coloca en el lugar de algún ser querido. Las veladoras iluminan el panteón cuando cae la noche.

Los integrantes del grupo de préstamo son:

Ramona - Venta De Mojarra
María - Venta De Toperware
Gregoria - Venta De Refrescos
Catalina - Venta De Abarrotes
Vanesa – Venta De Frutas Y Verduras 
Lucina – Venta De Refrescos

Catalina es una persona responsable, honesta, humilde y carismática. Desde hace ya 4 años aperturó en casa una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual invirtió un préstamo en otra ocasión y el cuál le ayudo a mejorar sus ganancias. En esta ocasión, Catalina quiere volver a invertir en mercancía: arroz, sopa, frijol, huevos, leche, azúcar, café, queso, galletas, aceite,  detergente, para ofrecer un amplio surtido a sus clientes. Actualmente Catalina está al cuidado de sus padres “Ellos cuidaron de mi cuando yo no podía cuidarme sola, ahora yo cuidare de ellos”. Fue por ese motivo que emprendió su negocio además de que es una actividad que le permite estar al pendiente de sus padres, motivada también por sus hermanos. "Espero poder ampliar la tienda y convertirla en un mini súper con más productos".

*En la imagen: Catalina se encuentra hasta el final de la fila y viste una blusa de color azul.
texts.en:
The Lindero communal bank is a group located at the edge of a highway from which one can appreciate the fields of rubber and reed.  Very close by is the graveyard that, during the Mexican celebration of The Day of the Dead, fills with color from the arrangements that each family member humbly places at the place of a loved one.  The votive candles light up the burial place when night falls.

The members of the communal bank are:

Ramona - Knife Sales
María - Tupperware Sales
Gregoria - Beverage Sales
Catalina - Grocery Sales
Vanesa – Fruit and Vegetable Sales
Lucina – Beverage Sales

Catalina is a responsible, honest, humble and charismatic person.  Four years ago, she opened a small grocery store in her home.  She invested a loan in the store at another time, and it helped her improve her profits. At this time, Catalina wants to invest in merchandise again (rice, soup, beans, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, cheese, crackers, cooking oil and detergent) so she can offer her customers a wider variety of products.  Catalina takes care of her parents.  She says, "They took care of me when I couldn't care for myself, and now I will take care of them."  That was her motivation in starting her business.  It is also an activity that allows her to look out for her parents.  Catalina was also encouraged by her siblings to open the store.  She adds, "I hope to be able to expand the store and convert it into a mini-mart with more products." 

In the above photo, Catalina is at the end of the line and wearing a blue blouse.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soup, beans, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, cheese, crackers, cooking oil and detergent.

loans.name: Husik

texts.en:
Husik lives in Stepanavan town with his wife and 16-year-old son. 
A contractor by profession, Husik has been working as an advertising agent for many years. More specifically, he receives different orders and produces different advertising billboards and panels. 
To cover his current orders, Husik needs some financial support. He asks lenders to support him to purchase materials for advertising services (billboards production, advertising panels). 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials for advertising services (billboards production, advertising panels)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike, to transport his products to market while they are fresh

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is a 27-year-old single man, living with his family of four members in Al Baqaa. Bashar is a serviceman in the military. He was not able to get a college education earlier, because of his family's financial situation. Because he wanted to improve himself in the job, he registered in the university to study Management. He has decided to take a loan to pay his semester fees. He plans to pay back in installments, from his salary.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees and study Management.

loans.name: Menevar

texts.ru: Меневар 59 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. У Меневар - среднее образование, она на пенсии и с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Меневар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 бычка и 25 овец. Дети в свободное время активно помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет чуть более 11,000 сом (KGS). Доходов катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и удовлетворение всех нужд семьи, поэтому Меневар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для реализации молока, так как у Меневар уже есть потенциальные клиенты. Доходы от кредита позволят Меневар развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Menevar is 59 years old, a widow and has 3 children. Menevar has a secondary education. Since her retirement in 2000, she has been involved in agriculture, providing an income for her family. Thanks to Menevar's hard work, today her business has 2 bulls and 25 sheep. Her children actively help with the business in their free time. The monthly profit from the business amounts to just over 11,000 som (KGS). The earnings are catastrophically not enough for a decent life and satisfying all of the family's needs, and this is why Menevar requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy dairy cows in order to sell milk because Menevar already has potential customers. The earnings from the loan will allow Menevar to develop her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk production and raise her family's income

loans.name: Magdalena Ernestina

texts.es:
Magdalena de 74 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo a quien ella misma logro sacar a delante a pesar de estar sola. Es comerciante, se dedica a elaborar quesadillas artesanales producto que es llevado al extranjero por familiares y amigos. Aprendió con su abuela, es un trabajo que ha pasado a través de varias generaciones. En sus tiempos libres le colabora a su hijo atendiendo una farmacia que este tiene.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar harina, levadura, cuajada y demás para elaborar quesadillas, ya tiene varios pedidos y tiene que encargar la cuajada con anticipación.

Lo único que Magdalena desea es que Dios le preste vida para disfrutar de su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 74, has one son who she raised on her own.  She has a small business making and selling quesadillas, some of which she sends to friends and families overseas.  She makes the quesadillas to a family recipe that she learned from her grandmother and that had been passed down from generation to generation.  In her spare time, Magdalena helps at her son't pharmacy business.

Magdalena is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies--flour, yeast, curds, etc.--for making quesadillas.  She has orders and needs to buy the curd in advance.

Magdalena's only hope for the future is that God grant her a long life with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared food business.

loans.name: Nyomo Bei Group

texts.en: These six ladies comprise the group called Nyomo Bei. On average they are 30 years old, each with two children. They live in nuclear families in Teshie, Accra. They know each other as neighbors and friends and through their work. In order to bolster their financial capacity and better manage their businesses, they have joined the ID-Ghana micro finance institution and are now on their second loan. The previous loan has been fully repaid. The group members sell groceries, underwear, ladies' dresses, pastries, kids' shoes and vegetables. Patience has been selling panties, brassieres and ladies' dresses for 14 years. She is standing at the far right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy panties, brassieres and ladies' dresses from wholesalers to sell to customers. She sells to her customers door-to door. She plans to earn a good monthly income which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan. The group will need GHS 4,400 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy panties, brassieres and ladies' dresses from the wholesalers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Angel Ballena

texts.en: Angel is a 48-year-old organic avocado grower. He lives in the Chao Valley on Peru's north coast. He is not married but looks after his entire family and wants to continue the family tradition of farming. Angel’s family moved to Peru’s coast 50 years ago and fought hard to keep their land during the period of the agrarian reform which expropriated land without compensation. His father, the family patriarch, did everything to keep his entire family together. At first, Angel’s family cultivated and traded corn. Recently, Angel took over the fieldwork from his aging father (pictured with him, in a straw hat). He began planting avocado and asparagus for their own consumption. Then he learned about the organic production of avocado from Fairtrasa. He found the idea very good because he could have the possibility to get higher yields, preserve the quality of their farmland and take care of his family because they would no longer get exposed to toxic pesticides. Angel is seeking a $700 loan to buy organic fertilizers to improve his family’s organic avocado production.

loans.use: to pay for organic fertilizer so that he can grow more and better organic avocados

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma and her family raise sheep and poultry on their farm. They used to gather their animals' waste and pile it up outside the farm, which was producing bad smells, contaminating watersheds and attracting swarms of flies. By acquiring her own Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Irma and her husband will be able to input the waste directly in the biodigester, eliminating smells and letting bacteria and the natural methanization process transform animals' manure into biogas and a nutrient-rich biofertilizer. They will displace the expensive fossil fuel (LP gas) and wood they used to cook and heat water by this renewable energy source. Further, Irma will not need to buy chemical fertilizers anymore. She will have the opportunity to apply the biofertilizer on her corn field and increase its yield in a natural way. This investment will therefore result in money and time savings, as Irma and her family used to walk several hours to collect wood in the surrounding mountains. Irma will not inhale the dangerous smoke anymore while she is cooking, and her farm will overall become an environment-friendly and comfortable place to live in.
This loan represents 16% of the cost of the biodigester; the remaining amount is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
Ashley is the oldest of seven children and believes in leading by example. Following her dreams of owning an event planning business is an example she is proud to show her family. 

As she works on her Master’s in Secondary Education, Ashley is excited to develop her skills as an event planner. She has already worked on an event that featured a major celebrity talk show host as the guest speaker, and she is eager to build on that experience. Ashley currently lives with her fiancée, a US marine veteran, and their 3-year-old son. Ashley’s event planning business will help her support her family.

Ashley’s business operates out of Newark, NJ. Ashley needs a loan to further her event planning education and launch her business, including a big marketing push. She is looking forward to make events fun, exciting, and stress-free for her clients!

loans.use: to pay for event planning education and a website to advertise planning services.

loans.name: Santalat

texts.ru: Санталат, 48 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Санталат среднее образование. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 10 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Благодаря упорному труду Санталат у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санталат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента продуктов питания в ее магазине. Доходы от кредита Санталат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своей деятельности.
texts.en: Santalat is 48 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Santalat has a secondary education. She is calm, leveled and hardworking. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in selling food products for 10 years. Thanks to Santalat's hard work, today she has a working capital of merchandise in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Santalat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to expand the selection of products at her store. Santalat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale in order to expand the product selection at her store

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años de años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa, 45, lives in her own house with her three children. She has worked selling personal use products for several years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she also sells on foot in the different neighborhoods. Rosa is applying for a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. all in bulk and to therefore be able to continue with her work to have more income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es: Atilio de 48 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su Pick up desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Atillo, 48, lives in his own house with his life partner and their son. He has worked taking trips in his pickup for the past 20 years. He has many customers who prefer him because of the responsibility he has when driving. With what he earns, he achieves resolving the expenses that come up in his home. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of tires and to maintain his vehicle, since this is his only source of work and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.en: Miguel Angel is a client who has already borrowed on credit and repaid his loan. He used credit for his business selling clothes to customers at a low price.. Miguel Angel again is looking for credit to continue to invest in his business and to make it grow. He is a person who has been able to benefit from loans handled properly. Being able to invest in business as he has done has shown his commitment to meet business objectives.

loans.use: to invest in his clothing business.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es:
María de 58 años de edad, es viuda y no tiene hijos, es ama de casa y no ha tenido una vida fácil. María es ama de casa y también trabaja como empleada doméstica en casas vecinas haciendo oficios y cuidando niños.

El préstamo será utilizado para construir una habitación en su vivienda para una pareja que no tiene donde vivir, de esta manera ellos tendrán techo para vivir y le harán compañía a ella porque no quiere estar sola. Antes pasaba mucho tiempo sin compañía y eso la enfermaba.

María espera ayudar a esa pareja ya que los quiere como los hijos y nieto que nunca tuvo.
texts.en:
María, 58, is a widow and has no children.  She hasn't had an easy life and makes a bare living cleaning other people's houses and caring for their children.  

María is applying for a loan that she will use to build a room for a friend who has nowhere else to go.  The addition will help both women: María's friend will have a place to live and María--who doesn't like living alone--will have her friend's company.

María adds that her friend is like the children and grandchildren she never had.

loans.use: to add a bedroom to her house.

loans.name: Muong Phang 11 Group

texts.en:
La is 28 years old, married and has two children, an 11-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. She lives with her husband and her two children, along with her parents-in-law, in a Thai traditional house in a remote village where people rely on agricultural production. Like many other households in the village, her family's source of income mainly comes from farming, in which cultivating rice is the most important production. However, the income from rice farming is not enough to cover her family's living expenses. This has motivated La and her husband to increase production in animal husbandry by raising pigs, fish, chickens and ducks. 

This is the second time that La has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy small fish to expand animal husbandry and earn more income. She believes her investment in fish farming will go smoothly, especially with the training and counselling from the staff of the program. La hopes that her family, especially her children, will be more prosperous in life and will soon escape from poverty.

loans.use: to buy small fish to expand animal husbandry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for four new tires and repair the vehicle.

loans.name: Julia Carina

texts.es:
Julia es una madre dedicada, con una hermosa familia conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos, siempre lucha por el bienestar de sus seres queridos y por iniciativa propia desde hace muchos años trabaja como obrera de campo en su ciudad natal, Ica. Su mayor motivación en la vida son su hijos, por ellos es que Julia trabaja más de 8 horas al día para poder brindarles una mejor educación y verlos convertidos como grandes profesionales.
Julia quiere agradecer a los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá apoyar a su esposo a realizar realizar sus trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, con esto podrá postular a una oferta de trabajo que tiene como propuesta y así presentar todos sus papeles en regla. Con esto ambos podrán sacar adelante a su familia y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Julia puts her family first.  She wants the best for her husband and their two children and she works hard to provide for them in whatever way she can.  She has worked as a farm laborer in the Ica area for many years and says that she does the back-breaking work to ensure that her children get good educations and have a chance at professional careers one day.
Julie wants Kiva lenders to know that she is grateful for their support.  She will use your loans to pay for her husband's commercial driving permit and related fees.  Her husband has a job offer that requires the permit and needs the correct paperwork to accept the offer.  The investment will help the whole family to build a better future.

loans.use: to pay for a commercial driving permit and related fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives on a hilltop in Nyamira, Kenya with his wife and their five children. From his small, but immaculately clean mud house he can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. He can also see a bright future, thanks to the income he earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Charles passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of his cows “Nyabarati” (from a person’s name). Because of his immense farming knowledge, he has turned his farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate his model in their own farmland. 

However, the biggest challenge he faces is satisfying the demand for milk in his village. The demand is overwhelming. He is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. He believes that through the loan he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and be able to pay back the loan.

Charles is confident that if you invest in his dream, you will be impacting the life of his family and especially his children.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of  dairy cow

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe YEREDON  ont en moyenne 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments. Les femmes du groupe YEREDON sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. DJENEBA,   la seule assise sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux sacs de choux pommés, 10kgs de piments et d’oignons. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Tominian. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeredon group have an average age of 27 and, on average, two children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

These women met because of being related, and they buy and sell various items, cereals, and condiments. The women from the Yeredon group are on their first solidarity loan. Djeneba, the only woman seated in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of cabbages and 10 kg of hot peppers and onions. She buys her supplies right there in Tominian. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often for credit. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which will be used for expenses relative to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with any remainder being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his milling equipment.

loans.name: La Selva Primera Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad alejada del municipio, las personas se dedican la agricultura y ganadería, algunos adultos de la selva hablan el mazateco, su lengua materna. Es esta localidad rodeada de plantaciones de caña se formó un grupo llamado La Selva Primera, las clientas que lo integran son carismáticas, amables, alegres, trabajadoras:

Felicitas – Servicio  De Papeleria
Jacinta - Venta De Poll0
Susana - Venta De Frutas Y Verduras
Lea – Venta De Cosmeticos, Huevos De Rancho
Maria Del Rosario - Venta De Cerdos
Maria - Venta De Tacos
Virginia - Servilletas Bordadas
Carolina -Crianza Y Venta De Pollo
Lucia -Venta De Comida 
Francisca - Medicina Naturista
Madai -Venta De Comida

Lea  está casada con Roberto quien se dedica a trabajar la tierra y es madre de 4 niños, tres de ellos patrocinados por World Vision México. Desde hace ya tres años Lea se ha dedicado a la venta de perfumes por catálogo. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El gusto por los animales también llevó a Lea a dedicarse desde hace 5 meses a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras e iniciar con la venta de huevos de rancho obteniendo buenas ganancias. Actualmente tiene 40  gallinas y un solo gallo, por lo que necesita un préstamo par comprar tres gallos más y continuar con la crianza. También quiere comprar más alimento y malla para para acondicionar el corral donde conserva a los animales. “Es bonito escuchar cantar las gallinas y que en lugar de reloj despertador sea el gallo lo que nos despierte”. Lea no ha dejado a un lado la venta de perfumes, por las tardes sale a mostrar su catálogo para levantar pedidos, entregar mercancía y realizar sus cobros. Orgullosa, Lea comenta que su esposo le ayuda con el cuidado de las gallinas y sus pequeños son quienes recogen los huevos que van poniendo las gallinas. 

*En la imagen: Lea está de pie en la fila del frente y es la primera de derecha a izquierda, viste una blusa floreada.
texts.en:
In a community far from the city, the people make their livings in agriculture and raising livestock.  Some of the adults, from the jungle, speak "mazateco," their native tongue.  This area is surrounded by reed plantations.  And the communal bank that formed there is called "La Selva Primera" (The Jungle First).  The members that make up the bank are charismatic, friendly, happy and hard-working people. 

Felicitas – Stationary Service 
Jacinta - Chicken Sales
Susana - Fruit and Vegetable Sales
Lea – Cosmetic Sales and Free-Range Egg Sales
Maria Del Rosario - Pig Sales
Maria - Taco Sales
Virginia - Embroidered Napkins
Carolina - Raising and Selling Pigs
Lucia - Food Sales 
Francisca - Natural Medicine
Madai - Food Sales

Lea is married to Roberto, who makes his living working the land.  Lea is the mother of four children, three of whom are sponsored by World Vision México.  For the last three years, Lea has made her living selling perfumes from a catalog.  With her earnings, she helps her husband with the household expenses.  Five months ago, her love of animals lead Lea to raising laying hens.  She started selling the free-range eggs, which has earned her a good profit.  She currently has forty hens and only one rooster, so she needs a loan to purchase three more roosters and continue raising her hens.  She also wants to purchase more feed and mesh to fix up the corral where she keeps the animals.  Lea says, "It's nice to hear the hens clucking, and instead of an alarm, it's the rooster that wakes us up."  Lea hasn't given up her perfume sales.  In the afternoons, she goes out to show her catalogs and drum up orders, deliver merchandise and collect payments.  Lea proudly tells us that her husband helps her with caring for the hens, and her little ones go out and collect the eggs that the hens have laid. 

In the above photo, Lea is standing in the first row, is first from the right and is wearing a flowered a top.

loans.use: to purchase three roosters, feed and mesh.

loans.name: Marapat

texts.ru: Марапат 43 года, вдова, есть 3 детей. У Марапат среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и одной воспитывать детей, младшему сыну Марапат 15 лет. Поэтому уже 4 года, она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок и 1,95 ГА земли, где Марапат выращивает пшеницу и клевер. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет всего 15,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Марапат  и ее детей. А так как источник доходов Марапат - это сельское хозяйство, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Марапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Marapat is 43 years old, a widow and has 3 children. Marapat has a secondary education. It is difficult to find work in the village, but necessary to support the family and raise the children by herself. Marapat's youngest son is 15 years old. This is why she has been involved in agriculture for 4 years. Today her business has 2 cows, 1 calf and 1.95 hectares of land, where Marapat grows wheat and clover. Her monthly income amounts to only 15,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life for Marapat and her children. And because agriculture is Marapat's source of income, she requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow with a calf in order to increase her livestock headcount. Marapat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities, which will allow her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a cow with a calf in order to increase her livestock headcount and business income

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.en:
Cristobal has always loved service. He started as a health service representative and says it “gave me the passion of looking beyond the offer.” He has served as a Sierra Club Outing Leader in his home area of Puerto Rico. He also had a food stand, and he enjoyed receiving many visitors from all over the world, “opening a little bit of me to them.”

These days, Cristobal runs a small-scale residential cleaning service. Many Puerto Rican residents will do short-term rentals for tourists; as each set of renters leave, these properties need to be cleaned. Cristobal saw an opportunity to provide landscaping, cleaning, and general handyman work for these properties. He has a few properties under contract to maintain and is looking to expand.

Cristobal’s cleaning service business supports himself and his son, a special education student. The flexibility of owning his own business allows Cristobal to be available whenever his son needs him. He is the sole full-time employee and one of his neighbors is a part-time employee.

With this loan Cristobal will purchase an industrial vacuum. This vacuum will increase Cristobal’s efficiency and allow him to successfully expand his services.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning equipment (an industrial vacuum) and expand services

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is aged 34 years. He has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.The person on the left is another cattleman.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a hardworking single lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a boutique selling first class clothes, a business she has been running since 2012. She faces challenges of competition and the ever-changing fashions and designs in the market. Besides that, she hopes to have a well-stocked business and serve her customers better. 

Shakila needs a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a forty-two-year-old man married with eight children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in slaughtering animals and cocoa buying and selling as he works very hard to keep his business going. He hopes to educate all his children until they complete school. He has cocoa gardens which supplement his income from the business. His major challenge is inadequate capital. 

Gideon needs the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Sagrado Corazón de Jesús, está conformada por once integrantes, madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad,  son originarias de Tilica, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Ogracia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación. El negocio consiste en preparar comida casera como gallo pinto, tacos, tostones, carne asada, pollo frito, tajadas, enchiladas, maduros, ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. LA Asociación comunal Sagrado Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Communal Association "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" is composed of eleven members. They are all responsible mothers with fifteen children under their care. They are native of Telica, a place located in the western part of the region. Unfortunately, they were not able to go to school and had to work since early age to help with household expenses. Currently, they work hard every day to give their children a better future. Thanks to their desire to get ahead, the group coordinator, Ogracia sells food in her house. The business consists of preparing home made dishes such as: gallo pinto (rice and beans), tacos, tostones (fried plantains), baked meat, fried chicken, tajadas (fried plantains), enchiladas, maduros (fried sweet plantains). She works eight hours a day in her business. She offers her services so that in a near future she can have a better income. The Communal Association "Sagrado Corazon de Jesus" is grateful to the Kiva lenders, who give the means to have a decent job to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy items to prepare dishes such as: gallo pinto (rice and beans) , tacos, tostones (fried plantains), baked meat, fried chicken,  tajadas (fried plantains), enchiladas, fried sweet plantains.

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNA LUZ AL DESARROLLO” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados a prestar servicios y al comercio minorista. Olinda tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la crianza de aves domésticos patos gallinas y pavos para luego expenderlos a los mercados y a sus vecinos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus aves. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Olinda es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The group “UNA LUZ AL DESARROLLO” [A LIGHT TO DEVELOPMENT] is a group consisting of members who make their livings providing services and in retail sales. 

Olinda is 37 years old and has a life partner and two children. She makes a living breeding poultry--ducks, chicken, and turkeys--and later selling them to markets and her neighbors. The loan will be invested in purchasing feed for her birds. 

The group thanks KIVA investors for the loan provided. Olinda is the first person sitting to the right.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco APU LLALLAHUANI DE KALLACANCHA,el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Kallacancha,provincia de Paucartambo  departamento de Cusco.
El socio Marcelino tiene 51 años de edad es casado y tiene 06 hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, él socio lleva años dedicando a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio sie4mbra lo que son papas entre otros, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas ya bono.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner is belongs to the bank Apu Llallahuani de Kallacancha. The bank is located in the community of Kallacancha, Province of Paucartambo, Department of Cusco. Marcelino is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. He alternates his daily activities while making a living from agriculture. He has been doing this activity for years, in which he does well because of the effort he puts in his business. He plants potatoes and other vegetables. He wishes to be able to continue working so as to continue helping his family.

He requested a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser. He feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay the agreed fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Randy Michelle

texts.es:
Randy es un joven muy emprendedor, tiene muchos deseos de superación, por ello está estudiando la carrera de Derecho en una Universidad de su ciudad natal, Ica. Tiene una pequeña hija quien es su mayor motivación para salir adelante, y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle lo mejor. Desde hace varios años trabaja como taxista con un carro que tiene, con esos ingresos está solventando sus gastos de estudio, de su hogar y su pequeña hija, él confía en que todo le vaya bien y pueda salir adelante porque siempre actúa correctamente.
Randy en esta oportunidad piensa utilizar el dinero para poder solventar sus gastos de estudios como pago de su mensualidad de su Universidad. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto continuará con su carrera para más adelante convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Randy is a very entrepreneurial young man. He has a great desire to achieve, and for this reason he is studying law at a university in Ica, the city of his birth. He has a little daughter who is his great motivation to get ahead and for whom he strives every day to be able to offer her the best. For a number of years he has worked as a taxi driver with a car that he has. With this income he is paying for the expenses of his studies, his household, and his little daughter. He is confident that everything will go well for him and he will be able to advance because he always acts correctly.

At this time Randy is thinking of using the money to be able to pay for the expenses of his studies, such as his monthly fee at his university. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, and he wants them to know that with this he will continue with his course in order to become a great professional in the future.

loans.use: to pay the monthly fee for his law course

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell. 

Lawrence requested a loan, which will use to buy a new engine for his vehicle. He has a dream of buying another vehicle after experiencing some good returns from his vehicle. He faces a challenge of accidents on the road.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys is aged 62 years. He is married with 12 children aged between 18 and 40; four of them go to school. He has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase his standard of living.The additional man in the photo is another cow boy.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged 42 years, is married with three children aged between 4 and 10; two of them go to school. He has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from his business will be used to pay school fees for his children. The second person is a cow boy.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
