Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and build a shed

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
Gloria de 55 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado de educación básica, está casada. Su pareja es pensionado. Tiene tres hijos ya casados. Gloria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y cuida dos nietos, por lo cual recibe un ingreso económico. A los niños los cuida en su casa y el horario es de 7:00 am a 12:00 md. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar las puertas de su vivienda y hacer una instalación eléctrica. Le mejorará las condiciones de vida y por lo tanto vivirá más tranquila, entonces tendrá mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando más fuerte con la venta de cosméticos, ya que el esfuerzo es solamente para ella y su esposo. El Préstamo le ayudará mucho porque podrá realizar de una vez su trabajo y así con un poco de la pensión de su esposo y las ganancias de su negocio ir pagando las cuotas del préstamo a Credicampo.
texts.en:
Gloria, 55 years old, studied until the 7th grade of basic education. She is married and her husband is retired. She has three children who are married. She works selling cosmetics and takes care of two grandchildren, for which she receives a monetary income. She takes care of the children in her house and the schedule is 7:00am to 12:00pm. 

The loan that she is requesting is to repair the doors of her home and to do electric installation. It will improve her life conditions and therefore she will live more calmly, so then she will have a better quality of life.

Her dreams are to be able to continue working harder with the sale of cosmetics, since the effort is only for herself and her husband. The loan will help her a lot because she will be able to carry out her work once and for all and in that way, with a little bit of her husband’s pension and the earnings of her business, she will pay the loan fees to Credicampo.

loans.use: to repair the doors of her house.

loans.name: Ivan Marcelino

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose a  brindar el servicio de transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is continuing to offer transportation services. He has had his business for some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into it each day.

He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family. He is requesting the loan in order to carry out maintenance on his vehicle. He is grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIDA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Remedios es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, venta de ropa usada, tejido de busos, venta de papa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Remedios es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de tejido a macrame; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en una institución técnica.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará el aumento del capital (compra lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. " FLOR DE VIDA" ("FLOWER OF LIFE") begin its first cycle at "Pro Mujer" ("Pro Woman") as part of the Focus Center of Achacachi, which is comprised of eight members and headed by a board, of which Mrs. Remedios is the President. The members of the community association carry out various businesses, including: weaving blankets, selling food, construction services, selling used clothing, weaving macrame and selling potatoes.
 
The loan would benefit the micro-entrepreneurs of which Mrs Remedios is a member. Mrs Remedios says it is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at her home. Mrs Remedios currently has a business weaving macrame, which she learned at a technical institution.

The loan will increase her capital by enabling her to purchase wholesale wool from wholesalers from the city of La Paz, which would enable her to meet market demand. 

Her work allows her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has two children.

In particular Ms. Remedios likes training offered by the "Pro Mujer" institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wool

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel continua dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua administrando el carro que presta servicio de transporte, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Isabel continues to work in the transportation field, as she has for years.  It's going well for her thanks to the hard work that she brings to the job. She continues to manage the use of her car, providing transportation services. She wants to keep working and supporting her family this way.  This loan will be used to do maintenance work on her car. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Luz Carlota continua con su negocio  de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos, casacas y blusas,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Carlota continues in her work selling clothing. She sells pants, sweaters, polos, dress coats, and blouses. She's been doing this for some time now and it's going well for her thanks to the hard work she brings to every day. She wants to keep working in this way and supporting her family. Carlota is requesting this loan to buy dress coats for her business in resale. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy dress coats for resale

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Don Mauricio se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de güisquil,cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Don Mauricio vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus cosechas y ventas, y asi poder continuar teniendo mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Don Mauricio has worked in agriculture for 10 years, in particular in the cultivation of güisquil. When it is time to harvest, he sells his crops in neighboring towns and he has many loyal customers. Don Mauricio lives in his own home with his wife and five children. He is asking for a new loan so he can purchase fertilizers, manure, plague control, herbicides etc so he can improve his land and crops. The photo here is proof that everything has been going well for him in regards to his harvest and sales. This will help him to continue improving his earnings.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, and other products for his crop.

loans.name: Andrea Elizabeth

texts.es: Andrea tiene 22 años de edad, ella  es casada y tiene una hija de 3 años, ella vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza  y comercialización de  animales, Andrea y su esposo se dedican a trabajar al jornal de trabajo en el campo, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos, la aspiración de Andrea es mejorar su negocio y trabajar duro para  en un futuro  comprarse una casita para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
Andrea is 22 years old, she is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in the country and works raising and selling animals.

Andrea and her husband work as daily labor in the countryside. With the loan money, they will purchase pigs. Andrea's aspiration is to improve her business and work hard so that in the future she can buy a small house to improve the quality of life for her child.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood to build a dozen chairs which someone has ordered

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
O senhor Luis e tecnico agrario, e casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais 3 a frequentarem o ensino primario e 3 o ensino secundario todos na sua responsabilidade..
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco e pagar a mao de obra para ampliar a sua casa .
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia.
 Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Luis is an agricultural technician and is married with 6 children, 3 of whom are in elementary school and 3 of whom are in high school. All of them depend on him financially.

He tells us that with this loan money he will buy sand, stone, zinc plates and also pay workers to help with a home addition project. His future plans are to expand the house further to give his family a better living space.

Luis promises to pay on time and would like to take out more loans in the future to reach his dreams.

loans.use: buy sand, stone, zinc plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un cibercafé ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de papelería, tintas para impresoras y darle mantenimiento a las computadoras, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman, who has had her faced blurred here in order to protect her identity,  is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She runs a cybercafe located in her home in an area of town with a lot of foot traffic, so she has a lot of customers. This young woman has her own home where she lives with her husband and son. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more paper, ink and printers so she can improve her computer service and to earn more money so she can aspire to a higher quality of life.

loans.use: purchase paper, ink and printers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting materials and tools for a start-up discount card business

loans.name: María Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María,  tiene 77 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad de edad e independientes. Su marido solo trabaja en ocasiones.
Doña María con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto  salir adelante  se dedica a la venta de naranjas, mangos, golosinas y otras cosas de picar, también compra artesanías hechas en paja toquilla las mismas que uno de sus hijos se lleva a vender a otras ciudades donde tienen mucha salida estos productos. Lleva más de 9 años dedicada al comercio, hace un año vedía ropa pero hoy vende estos productos y está muy contrenta porque tiene muchos clientes.  
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar naranjas, mangos, golosinas y artesanías. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por  la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "María Monserrate" communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a canton known for its rich, pre-colonial history and its artisan crafts which are known both at national and international levels. It is also from here that the famous straw hats originate.

María lives here in Montecristi. She is 77 years old, married and has six children with her husband, all of whom are now independent adults. María's husband only works from time to time. With her husband working so rarely and in order to earn a little money on her own and to get ahead, María sells oranges, mangos, sweets, and other snacks. She also buys craftwork made from straw, which one of her sons sells in other towns where there is a higher demand for these products. María has been doing this work for nine years and it helps her to get ahead. María is going to use this loan to buy oranges, mangos, sweets, and craftwork to sell. She is happy doing this work because she has lots of clients.  

María has been with the communal bank since the very beginning and she likes the help that is provided though loans. María's dreams are to stay healthy and to move ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mangos, sweets, and craftwork.

loans.name: Bulangalire Group

texts.fr: Madame Angeline est trésorière du groupe de crédit BULANGALIRE. Agée de 42 ans, mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés est épouse d’un cultivateur. Elle a débuté ses activités grâce aux revenus des récoltes de son champ. A ce jour, elle s’occupe de la vente de farine de manioc et de maïs tout près du marché central de la place. C'est ainsi qu'elle sollicite ce nouveau pret pour acheter 12 sacs de farine de mais. Elle compte devenir  grand fournisseur de farine de maïs dans la contrée. Toute fois, elle éprouve les difficultés des pertes dues quelques fois à la mauvaise qualité des produits.A cet effet, elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien.
texts.en: Ms. Angeline is the treasurer of the loan group BULANGALIRE. She is 42 years old, the mother of seven children, all in school, and the wife of a farmer. She began her business thanks to the revenues earned from harvesting her field. Today, she is busy with selling cassava flour and cornmeal near the local central market. For this reason, she is requesting this new loan to purchase 12 sacks of cornmeal. She plans on becoming a major supplier of cornmeal in the area. However, she has experienced difficulties with losses, sometimes due to the poor quality of her products. So she thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of cornmeal

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor está continuando la carrera de contabilidad y además finalizando la carrera de Administración de Empresas logrando adquirir conocimientos técnicos para desenvolverse en el ámbito contable administrativo.
Dentro de unos años se ve gerenciando grandes proyectos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior de Kiva lo uso para pagar las cuotas de su carrera que le fue de mucha utilidad.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, que representan muchos gastos para él y que quiere cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Victor is continuing to study for his degree in Accounting, and he also is finishing his degree in Business Administration, acquiring technical knowledge so that he can succeed in the field of Managerial Accounting.

In a few years, he sees himself managing large projects.  He says that he used his previous Kiva loan to pay for tuition, and it was very helpful to him.  

Today, Victor is requesting this loan to cover the fees he must pay to register his degree.  This costs a lot of money, and he needs to have the funds to cover this expense.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving; it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register and validate his degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bundel of mixed shoes.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre joven de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca en bote con red.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, paciente, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Isla Suriqui’ un pedazo de tierra ubicado en el lago Titicaca, estas tierras son accidentadas y rocosas, el clima del lugar es frío a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, la gente del lugar acostumbra usar ropa oscura o negra porque atrapa los rayos solares brindando la sensación de calor.
Juan es de tez  morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su trabajo es la pesca en bote con red, actividad que realiza diariamente de lunes a domingo. Las aguas del lago son frías casi heladas por lo que no son utilizadas para nadar (salvo nadadores profesionales y experimentados). Él y su bote ya llevan diez años trabajando en el negocio, por lo que el bote se encuentra averiado y no brinda la seguridad necesaria para realizar la pesca, la necesidad hace que el bote siga a flote hasta comprar uno nuevo y desecharlo. En el negocio las redes de pesca son la herramienta de mayor uso y se desgastan constantemente por lo que todo el tiempo las debe renovar. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos económicos para poder formar una familia. Él desea realizar la compra de un bote y redes de pesca.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote seguro, redes de pesca y con los beneficios formar una familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man aged 24. He is single and has no children. He runs a business fishing from his boat with nets. He is independent, enterprising, patient, optimistic, responsible and hard-working. He works in the community of ‘Isla Suriqui’, a piece of land located on the smaller lake of Lake Titicaca. This land is winding, rugged and rocky. The climate is cold, and the average height is 3800 metres above sea level. The local inhabitants normally wear dark and black clothing because it traps sunlight, giving a sensation of warmth.

Juan has a dark complexion and black hair, and is of medium height. His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for trade. He works fishing from his boat with nets, from Monday to Sunday. The waters of the lake are cold, almost freezing, which is why no-one swims in them, except for professional and experienced swimmers. 

He and the boat he uses have worked in the business for ten years, which is why it is damaged and is not sufficiently safe to fish. Necessity requires him to keep the boat afloat until he can buy a new one and get rid of it. In his business, fishing nets are one of the most widely-used tools and constantly wear out, which is why he has to replace them all the time.

This is his second series of loans with the organisation. He wants to use the money to buy a dinghy and fishing nets. His dream is to improve his income in order to start a family.

loans.use: to buy a dinghy and fishing nets

loans.name: La Nopalera Group

texts.es:
El grupo "La Nopalera" esta integrado por vecinos de una comunidad en el Estado de México. Comentan que se han dedicado al cultivo de nopales desde hace tiempo y ahora que la temporada de frío está cerca, quisieran anticiparse y comprar hule para cubrir sus cultivos pues temen que el clima seque toda la planta.

Guadalupe es integrante del grupo y tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el señor Filemón y juntos han formado una familia con 6 hijos de los cuales ya solo una niña depende de ellos. Además de cultivar nopales, vende productos de limpieza junto con su esposo. Durante un tiempo, Guadalupe ahorró parte de sus ganancias y actualmente tiene dos locales donde vende sus productos. Ella quisiera invertir un préstamo en abono para sus nopales y más productos de limpieza. 

Acerca del negocio de nopales que inició hace 4 años, Guadalupe comenta que también ha visto una evolución, pues al principio solía ofrecerlos en la calle, pero actualmente ya tiene clientes leales que llegan a su casa cada ocho días sin falta para llevar estas plantas a sus hogares.

Guadalupe está comprometida a seguir trabajando arduamente para apoyar a su esposo y con la educación de su hija quien actualmente estudia la secundaria. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Elias, Teresa y Ponciano quienes están interesados en mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The group "La Nopalera" is made up of a community of neighbors in Mexico. They say that they have made a living by growing cacti for a long time now and as the colder months approach, they want to anticipate any adverse conditions and purchase oilcloths to cover their crops because they fear that the climate will dry out the cacti. 

Guadalupe is a member of this group and she is 51 years old, married to Mr. Filemon and together they have formed a family of 6 children who are all now on their own with the exception of one daughter. Besides growing cacti, they also sell cleaning products. For a time, Guadalupe saved all her earnings and today they have two locations where they sell their products. She wants to invest in a loan in order to purchase manure for her cacti (nopales) and to purchase more cleaning supplies. 

She has been growing cacti for 4 years and Guadalupe says she has seen an evolution in her business because at the beginning she only sold her crop in the streets, but today she has loyal customers who come to her every day without fail in order to purchase from her. 

Guadalupe is committed to working hard in order to help her husband and to educate their daughter who is currently in high school. 

The other members of the group are: Elias, Teresa and Ponciano who are interested in improving their fields.

loans.use: purchase manure for their fields and also cleaning products.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is an industrious father who operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities like noodles, powdered milk, cooking oil, soap, biscuits, coffee, sugar and canned goods. He is 48-years-old and has five children. His oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 6. Together with his family, he lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

He has been operating the sari-sari store for more than 10 years now. Severino also engages in motorcycle transport services. He transports passengers from to remote areas and imposes a fee.

Severino has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy assorted stock for the store like beverages, toiletries, noodles, canned goods and also for maintenance for the motorcycle like tires and fuel. These are essentials tools that will help his store remain full of stock and also keep his motorcycle service at its best.

In the future, Severino would like to expand his both businesses to become sustainable to support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like beverages, toiletries, noodles, canned goods and maintenance for his motorcycle such as tires and fuel.

loans.name: Rhulinabo

texts.fr: Le client RHULINABO , âgé de 38 ans est travailleur au sein d'une institution sanitaire de la place, qui à travers une forte sensibilisation à pris connaissance du produit crédit éducation qu’offre HEKIMA à la population. C’est ainsi qu’il a sollicité un prêt pour lui permettre de payer les frais academiques. Pour cela, il félicite HEKIMA pour ce produit qui soulage les parents et étudiants dans la tracasserie de paiement des frais scolaires et academiques.
texts.en: This client, RHULINABO, is 38 years old, and he works in a local healthcare institution. By a thorough awareness, he has recognized the loan product for educational purposes offered to people by Hekima. Thus, he is requesting a loan to enable him to pay his educational costs. So he congratulates Hekima on this product, which alleviates parents and students from the red tape of covering schooling and academics costs.

loans.use: to cover the costs of education

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is 58-years-old and married with four children. Jolly works very hard to provide for them.

Jolly runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, shampoo, and other groceries. 

In the future, Jolly would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flowers for the Month of the Dead, as well as oil, beans, sugar, coffee and bread.

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en: Ahamed is a 25-year-old, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a tailor, and at the same time a farmer. He faces a challenge of little capital.  Also, he hopes of having a stable business and a healthy family. Ahamed needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 52 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her two children and husband. She has owned a small store located in her home for 8 years. She has many customers due to her good prices and kindness that she has when selling. She is seeking a loan to buy more soups, eggs, grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. so that she can have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. so that she can have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: Madame RIZIKI est âgée de 40 ans et vice-présidente du groupe SHUKRANI. Elle est mariée à un homme d'affaire de la place et mère de 4 enfants tous allant à l’école. Elle s’occupe de la vente des couvertures au marché central de la ville, c'est ainsi qu'elle sollicite un nouveau prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter un ballon de couvertures et payer le transport afin de réaliser son rêve de devenir une grande commerçante. En dépit de son vœu, elle éprouve des difficultés de mévente. Enfin, elle remercie HEKIMA pour le renforcement des activités des femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en: Ms. RIZIKI, aged 40, is the vice-president of the group SHUKRANI. She is married to a local businessman, and she is the mother of four children, all attending school. She is busy with selling blankets at the town’s central market. Thus, she is requesting a new loan enabling her to purchase a bale of blankets and to pay for transport, so as to realize her dream of becoming a major merchant. Despite her wishes, she experiences difficulties with poor sales. So, she thanks Hekima for bolstering the businesses of low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of blankets and to pay for transport

loans.name: Aldar

texts.en:
Aldar is 30-years-old and lives with his wife in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as police officer since 2007. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. 

He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as felts, fiberglass, and foam in order to insulate his ger before winter. This will help him burn less coal during winter, saving money and releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to insulate his home in order to reduce coal usage.

loans.name: Lout's Group

texts.en:
Lout, 50, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province and is a mother of two children. She works hard selling vegetables, and her husband is a motor taxi driver to earn extra income. 

For Lout, this is her seven cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In this group of two, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes that she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old university student majoring in accounting, and he is in his last year of study. His father is working outside the country. Mohammad would like to start depending on himself by finding a job in his field of study after graduating. But he currently doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. He also wants to buy books and tools that he needs for his study. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tamales de elote su negocio lo tiene en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, adicional a eso también vende ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logar salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de elotes por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Teodora is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her son. She has spent several years dedicated to the sale of corn tamales. Her business is in a busy area, and for that reason, she has many customers. Additionally, she sells clothing. With what she obtains from work, she is able to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk to continue her sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes por lo fresco del producto y los buenos precios, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor para obtener mejores ingresos y así tener junto con su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old, and she is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her daughter. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 8 years, and her business is located in the municipal market. She has a lot of customers because of the freshness of her produce and her good prices.  

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more wholesale fruits and vegetables in order to obtain better earnings.  In this way, she and her daughter can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is grateful that she was previously granted a 51,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. With her earnings, she is able to meet her daily living expenses.

Now, she would like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan. She will use this new loan as her working capital, to buy more inventory items like rice, coffee, soda, noodles, frozen foods, and other groceries. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rose dreams of having a bigger general store. She prays to live a simple and quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .


*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory items like noodles, frozen foods, and other groceries

loans.name: 06-01-16 Chợ Nam Thành , Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thơm is the group leader of the 06-01-16 Chợ Nam Thành, Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Thơm is 45 years old, and she is married with 2 children.

Thơm has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell. 

In 2013, Thơm joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Thơm hopes that her business profit will help her children to do well in school, her family to be healthy and happy, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 65 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Celsa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines, for which she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Experia has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and she has 3 children. She has been in business since 2000 when she started with her own working capital of $200.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

She is taking this loan to buy additional supplies to stock in her store including soaps, perfumes, deodorants, hair oils, glass cleaners, mops, slippers, and other items. She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more perfumes and toiletries.

loans.use: To buy soaps, perfumes, deodorants, hair oils, glass cleaners, mops, slippers, and other items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nelpa

texts.en:
Nelpa is a married woman who is 40 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelpa has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials and ingredients like fish, salt, etc. for her business.

Nelpa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and ingredients like fish, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 36, is a smallholder farmer from Kaptumo, in the North Rift region of Kenya. She runs a mixed farm on a 2-acre piece of land that belongs to the husband she married 10 years ago when she became a farmer. From this activity, she generates a decent income that she uses to take care of her 4 children's needs. 
 
Nancy's farm has 2 cows, 3 chickens, tea, bananas and trees. She is seeking a small loan of 20,000 KES that she will use to purchase more poultry, construct poultry housing and buy farm items. She has observed that poultry products at a fair price are in high demand. This loan investment will help her develop the poultry farm and acquire a brood of hens to lay more eggs for sale. 

This investment will greatly increase Nancy's income, which will enable her to satisfy her family's basic needs and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and single. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She operates a sari-sari store, which she has been doing for four years. 

Rowena requested a loan, which she will use to restock her store with basic commodities such as milk, sugar, and salt. In the future, Rowena hopes that she can complete school and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en:
Nazaket is 42 years old and married, and she has 3 kids. Her husband is a farmer and helps Nazaket in animal husbandry. She has been breeding cows and selling dairy products for 15 years, and her monthly income is 300 AZN.

People have high demands in dairy products because they are very good for their health. They buy milk, cheese and butter every day and use these products to prepare delicious things for the morning. Local people prefer to buy these products from Nazaket because they are always fresh and tasty. 

She has a good job, but unfortunately her income doesn’t cover all her family's demands because she has only two cows. She has applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy three additional cows and increase the productivity and income of the farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 40 years old and married with two children; and with both her children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 43 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. Махабат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 10 лет занимается разведением скота. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Махабат имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 21 овцу. Деятельность Махабат приносит ей ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 10,000 сом (KGS). Однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, Махабат с оптимизмом идет по жизни и не унывает, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, что позволит ей увеличить поголовье скота и будущие доходы ее семьи.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. As a main source of income for her family, Mahabat has worked with livestock breeding for a period of 10 years. Thanks to her persistent work, Mahabat currently has two cows and 21 sheep on her farm. 

Mahabat's business brings her a monthly income of around 10,000 som (KGS). Even if this money is however not enough for living costs, Mahabat is not discouraged but goes through life with optimism. Therefore, with an aim to develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows. This will allow her to increase the number of livestock and the family's future income.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her income

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en:
Sophan is 39 years old and a mother of one child living in Battambang province in Cambodia. She sells grocery items as her main source of income and also drives a taxi to supplement her income. 

This is Sophan's seventh loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund Cambodia. All her previous loans were fully repaid, and each has gradually helped lift her standard of living. 

Now Sophan leads a group of 4 members to request a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. 

Sophan hopes that she can continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hundredweights of corn and lime.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 46 years old and lives in Navalan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Judy is currently raising 5 piglets to sell in the market, a business she has been in for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to buy 3 sacks of feed and vitamins which will help her piglets keep healthy and grow faster. July will sell the meat in the market. 

Judy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. In the future, she dreams of having her own jeep to serve her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of feed and vitamins.

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with four children, who all attend school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from tricycle passengers. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 41 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her animals.

Lilia has been raising livestock for 21 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully paid back her most recent loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Orbesa

texts.en:
A married parent of three children, Orbesa works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Orbesa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Orbesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан, 45 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, младшая дочь - школьница, живет с родителями. У Гулумкан- среднее образование. С 2005 года, Гулумкан занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 лошади, 3 бычка, 2 теленка и 20 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,5 ГА, где Гулумкан и ее муж выращивают кукурузу. Семья с радостью берется за любую работу, а дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулумкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Гулумкан является лидером группы "Береке", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Гулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulumkan is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children. The youngest daughter is of school age and lives with her parents. Gulumkan has secondary education. Since 2005 she has worked with agriculture. Currently her farm has two cows, three horses, three bull-calves, two calves and 20 sheep. She also has a plot of land of 0.5 hectares, where she and her husband grow sweet corn. 

The family is happy to take on any kind of work, and the children help actively with the farm. With an aim to further develop her business, Gulumkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep to fatten and sell. 

Gulumkan is the leader of the group "Bereke". In addition to her, the group consists of two other people. They are the only three members. Gulumkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married.  She has ten children two of whom are currently in school. 

Rosita is in the agricultural business as a pig farmer, which known pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been in pig fattening for 7 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercidita is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mercidita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercidita requested a 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, and other items for her business.

Mercidita has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, and other items for her business

loans.name: Sreypheak's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children, Sreypheak is 31 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income and weaves cotton scarves to earn more income. She can earn about 34,700 KHR per day.

For Sreypheak, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and cotton thread to support her businesses. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cotton thread to support her businesses.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Purevbat

texts.en: Purevbat, 30 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager at a construction company since 2012. His parents have retired from work and get state pensions. The apartment they live in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to renovate it. He will buy building materials such as fiberglass, cement and planks. After the renovation, his aged parents will live in a comfortable and warm place where heat won't be lost easily.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment in order to preserve energy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tile and doors.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 53 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a vegetable garden and at harvest time, she directly sells her vegetables to her neighbors. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer to make her vegetables healthy and to have more harvest. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family. 

Roxan requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Roxan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 42 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. To support her family's living condition, she grows rice and cassava. Moreover, she can earn extra income via cashew growing.

For Srey, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava fertilizers and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy cassava fertilizers and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including candy, shampoo, toothbrushes, glue, drugs, sugar, detergent, milk, and other things to sell. There are five members in the family including her 3 children and her husband. She has been doing business since 2001 with her own working capital of $100. She wants to open a big store in the future and so is taking this loan. She wants to improve her management of her business and increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy things to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leanghorn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Leanghorn is 25 years old and a mother of two young children. She struggles for a living via rice cropping. However, she can earn extra income making rice snacks. 

This is Leanghorn's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that that with fertilizer, she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 49, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He  one dependent child. He manages and operates a farm business on a land located near his house. He grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he can  earn  2.00USD  per day.

The current farm  is small and it can provide less benefit to him. Saroeun wants to enlarge his farm area but he can’t afford it. Therefore,  he would like to get KIVA loan to buy a plot to grow rice. He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living conditions. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 62 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widow with 1 child. 

She is a dealer with Avon Products, Inc. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan to purchase more Avon products to sell and earn more money to sustain the needs of her daughter and pay her obligations to the cooperative. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Emelia hopes that her daughter could finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn. She sends you her gratitude for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Analyn is very positive that she could improve her business further if you would let her borrow again, this time for an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional accessories and spare parts for her jeepney. Simultaneously, if the vehicle is regularly maintained and in good condition, she will be able to keep sustaining her family's needs.

Analyn hopes that her business will continue to help her support her children's educational needs. 

Analyn meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and spare parts for her jeepney.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She raised 2 pigs to sell and has had this business for 4 years.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to buy 3 piglets and to pay for renovation of her pig cage to give her business a big boost. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes that God will always bless her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 piglets and to pay for renovation of her pig cage

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bebelina

texts.en:
Bebelina is a 60-year-old married woman with eleven children. Three of her children are currently in school. Bebelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bebelina requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Bebelina has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Bebelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers/

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Trinidad is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Trinidad has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Trinidad has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kibuga B Bataka Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
Dinah, a member of Kibuga B Bataka Kwetungura group where each member guarantees the other, is a farmer growing food crops like maize and beans. At the same time she has a retail shop which adds more income for her. She faces challenges of weather changes and limited capital, but despite that fact,  she dreams of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Dinah needs a loan to improve her agriculture enterprise by applying mulch and buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to improve her agriculture enterprise by applying mulch and buying fertilisers.

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.es:
Los guatemaltecos son reconocidos por labrar la tierra y en la cría de animales desde décadas anteriores desde el comienzo de los mayas ellos tuvieron el privilegio de labrar la tierra y lo realizaron con mucho orgullo, tal como José de 58 años de edad casado con una gran visión hacia el futuro el realiza esta labor porque la heredo de su padre que realiza la misma labor en cultivar y en criar animales en  los campos fértiles de Guatemala.

El está con la visión de poder realizar este crédito para poder alcanzar logros más importantes en la vida, el emprendió el trabajo de la agricultura y cría de animales porque genera buena ganancia para el futuro de su familia.

La utilización que el realizara al nuevo crédito que el está realizando es para la compra de un toro para criarlo en un espacio disponible que tiene en su terreno para luego venderlo para obtener un ingreso económico. Con el primer préstamo que el realizo gracias a ello el pudo cultivar una cuerda de arveja  mas para tener mejores ingresos económicos para su familia.

Uno de los sueños de el es la siembra de mas arvejas y la crianza de mas toros  porque el no se conforma con lo poco que el tiene el quiere obtener más terrenos para siembras y crianzas de animales.
texts.en:
Guatemalans have been known since Mayan times for working the land and raising animals. This is a tradition that Jose Patrocinio maintains with pride. He is 58 years old, married and has a great vision for the future. He has this occupation because he inherited it from his father, who farmed and raised animals in the fertile fields of Guatemala. 

His vision is to obtain a loan to be able to achieve important objectives in his life. His job in agriculture and raising animals generates a good income for  his family's future. 

He will use the loan to buy a bull to raise it in his plot of land and sell it later to obtain a profit. He was able to cultivate peas with his first loan, which improved his income.

One of his dreams is to grow more peas and raise more bulls. He is not satisfied with the little he has and wants to obtain more land for farming and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Sokheam's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sokheam is 48 years old and the mother of three children. Nowadays, she raises pigs to earn income to support her family condition, and she raises fish for resale to supplement her income.

For Sokheam, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. In a group of three, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fish to raise. She hopes that her children can finish their studies successfully

loans.use: to buy more fish to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a 55 year old married man from Ormoc, Leyte. He has raised hogs for more than 4 years  as a source of income.

Alfredo wants to expand his business but lacks the financial resources to do so. He requests a loan  to buy piglets  and animal feed. This loan will help him to  raise more pigs to sell to the market.
 
In the future, Alfredo wants to make his business sustainable and productive. He also wants to save money for his son's schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets  and animal feed.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita runs a small sari-sari or retail store business to sell  various goods and items to the people in her village of  Leyte, Philippines. The 60 year old merchant has been in the business for more than two years. This business provides Anacorita the income that she needs for food and to pay her bills.

Anacorita is asking for a loan to buy  canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, condiments, soap and toiletries. This will help her to improve her stock and  attract more buyers to her store. 

She hopes to make her store more profitable and stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, noodles, soda,  beverages, condiments, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Maria Isadora

texts.en:
This is Maria Isadora. She is 38 years old and is from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates her food business that also helps her improve her daily income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Maria Isadora would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 11,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Maria Isadora dreams to have additional sources of income like rice distribution or reselling frozen goods for she wants to give her children good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a rice retailer from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two grown children. Angeles has sold rice for more two years as a source of  income. 

Angeles would like  a loan to buy more rice to sell. This will enable her  to sell more to her customers. In the future, Angeles hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Fishing has been a good business for most people in Carles, Iloilo in the Philippines. This includes Lydia, who is a resident of this place. Lydia is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. 3 of her children are already grown, and her youngest is 16 years old. 

For 30 years now, Lydia has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs to provide for her children. She is asking for a loan to continue improving her livelihood. Lydia will use the loan to buy fishing nets, nylon, rope, and fishing weights. 

Lydia finds joy in fishing and helping her husband, who is also a fisherman. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings, be more successful in business, and live a life of abundance.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon, rope, and fishing weights

loans.name: Jhonatan Alfredo

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Estudió con mucha dedicación la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas e Informática y actualmente se dedica a brindar servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de equipos de cómputo, instalación, formateo y hace poco está incursionando en la venta de equipos para computadora, discos duros, teclados, entre otros.
Jhonatan quiere tener mejores oportunidades laborales y ser reconocido como un excelente profesional, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder realizar los trámites para obtener su Título Profesional. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto Jhonatan mejorará su trabajo y así podrá mejorar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a very enthusiastic young man with a great desire to get ahead.  He is single and lives with his family in Ica.  He was very dedicated in his studies for his degree in Information Technology.  He currently works offering maintenance and repair services on computer equipment and offers installation and formatting services.  A short time ago he also got into selling computer equipment, hard drives, keyboards and other items. 
Jhonatan wants to have better work opportunities and to be recognized as an excellent professional.  That is why he is planing to use his loan to pay the fees necessary to get his diploma.  Jhonatan is very thankful for the Kiva lenders' generosity.  He wants them to know that with the loan, he will improve in his work and thereby give his family a better future.

loans.use: to pay the fees to get his diploma in Information Technology.

loans.name: Christine Joy

texts.en:
Christine Joy is married and has an ice vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now and works hard to support her family. 

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like plastic wrappers and pay for electric bills.

Christine Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plastic wrappers and pay electric bills for her ice vending business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn is 33 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Evelyn requested a PHP 27000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Esiteri

texts.en:
Esiteri, thirty-eight years old, is a single woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a retail shop and buys and sells cocoa. She is very hard-working and has managed to look after four children using the proceeds from her business. She started the business to cater for her family and she wants to expand her business into new markets.

Esiteri wants the loan to buy more cocoa for sale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food and ingredients to cook meals to sell to her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and  sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food and ingredients to cook meals and sell to her customers.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 29, is a striking, young kikuyu man from Nkubu, a remote location in Kenya. This ambitious bachelor has one goal in life, which is to succeed. 

William started farming 2 year ago, and his primary income source has been milk and banana farming. He is thankful to God that his business has been profitable so far. 

William is seeking a loan to jump-start horticulture farming. Land in Nkubu is very fertile, so the major challenge facing farmers like William is usually weed management. In a country characterized by food insecurity, William sees a big opportunity to start a business growing vegetables and other food crops. 

He is currently unable to put up the money to get the horticulture farm going because of the high cost farm-inputs such as equipment, seed, and fertilizer. For that reason, he is counting on your consideration to make his dream come true. 

With your loan, William will realize his dream and contribute in a small way towards the fight for food security in Kenya.

loans.use: to start a horticulture farm.

loans.name: Concepcion Gonzala

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 54-year old widow who lives with her family. She has no children. She is a food vendor, which is the family's primary source of income, who needs capital to make the business grow. 

Concepcion needs a loan to make a new work area for preparing and grilling food. She mentioned that access to parks is a must for her business to grow.

loans.use: buy a new working/cooking area

loans.name: Kort

texts.en: A local farmer living in Siem Reap Province, Kort is 37 years old, and a mother of four children. She overcomes her family’s hardships via rice cropping. Moreover, she also earns more income via cassava growing. This is her first loan with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy wood to build a new house. She hopes that she can have a house to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a new house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 43, raises pigs for a living. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now. She is a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 12. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. Her husband's occupation is a laborer. His earnings are not enough to pay the daily expenses of the family.  

Teresita has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase two additional pigs and pig feed. With these, she could raise and sell more healthy pigs in a few months. She could then provide her children with good food and better living conditions. In the future, Teresita hopes to have a stable income that can help support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase two additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Coleen

texts.en: Coleen is an 18-year-old from Lasilat, Baggao, Cagayan. She is currently taking up a Bachelor degree in education. She chose this course of study because she idolizes her mother who is a teacher, and so she dreams of becoming a teacher as well.  Her family farms corn and what they earn is sometimes insufficient to send her to college. So to be able to continue studying, Coleen wants to avail herself of a 10,000 PHP education loan from the KIVA lenders, which she will use to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.use: pay her college tuition

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
This is Ambrocio. He sends you his gratitude for your generosity because his previous loan had enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. The loan also helped him provide for daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could continue to improve his business with an additional amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies, accessories, and spare parts for the jeepney. Additionally, he could sustain the needs of his family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Ambrocio hopes that his business will continue to help support the educational needs of his children. He also desires to buy another jeepney to generate more income. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Silverina

texts.en:
Silverina is a 35-year-old woman who is married to Yakobus, a 40-year-old man and an entrepreneur. They have 3 children:  Nadia, 14, who is in the second grade of a junior high school; Adelia, 10, who is in the fifth grade of an elementary school; and Armando, 6, a Kindergarten student. 

Silverina helps her husband to produce additional income by establishing a business of selling daily needs items from her home-based location. The business has been in operation for 2 years. The income generated from this business has enabled Silverina to build a small kiosk in front of their house. Along with the growth of the business, Silverina wants to add more things in her kiosk to sell, however her income is not enough to do so. Then she heard about TLM from her neighbor and asked for an individual loan amounting IDR 4,500,000. The loan is used to buy sandals and kerosene, and restock any daily needs items to fulfill the demands of her customer near her house.

loans.use: buy daily needs items to sell

loans.name: Los Carrizales Group

texts.es:
Los Carrizales lleva por nombre un pequeño grupo integrado por 4 mujeres, las cuales viven en una zona cañera. Cerca de la comunidad se encuentran 4 ingenios (fábricas azucareras) donde la caña es sometida a una serie de procesos para obtener el endulzante preferido. La tranquilidad de la localidad, el clima caluroso, y los paisajes que se ven desde desde la carretera son otros atributos de la zona. 

Jessica - Venta De Lencería 
Maribel –Servicio De Estética
María –Venta De  Ropa Para Dama Y Caballero
Francisca - Venta De  Ropa Para Dama Y Caballero

Todas ellas son las integrantes del grupo. Maribel está casada con José Manuel y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad llamado Diego, es él quien llena la casa de agregaría siendo hijo único. Maribel y su familia viven en casa de su abuela quien desde hace mas de 20 años se ha hecho cargo de ella “más que mi abuelita, es mi madre”.

Desde hace 4 años y después de haber concluido sus estudios como estilista, Maribel se ha dedicado a prestar este mismo servicio. Al inicio no tenía un local, pero la situación ha cambiado gracias a las ganancias obtenidas. Ahora necesita un crédito para seguir reforzando su actividad con la compra de material como alicates, uñas postizas, pinceles, acrílico de colores, piedras (decoración) y una lámpara debido a que también se decía a poner uñas de acrílico de diferentes precios y estilos de acuerdo al gusto de sus clientas. Maribel quiere hacer esta inversión pues se aproxima diciembre y es cuando más trabajo tiene, entonces estará preparada.

"Gracias por confiar en nosotros y otorgarnos un préstamo para invertir en cada uno de nuestros negocios" comenta Maribel.

*En la imagen: Maribel viste una blusa a rayas.
texts.en:
Los Carrizales is a small group composed of 4 women that live in a sugar cane region. There are 4 sugar factories near the community. The community's peace, warm weather and landscapes are other of the region's attributes.

Jessica -- Lingerie sales
Maribel -- Beautician
Maria -- Clothing sales
Francisca -- Clothing sales

They are all members of the group. Maribel is married with Jose Manuel and has a 5-year-old son named Diego, who fills the house with happiness as he is the only child. Maribel and her family live in her grandmother's house. Her grandmother has taken care of her for over 20 years. Maribel says of her "more than a grandmother, she is my mother".

After finishing her studies as a hairstylist 4 years ago, Maribel has been working in this field. She did not have a shop, but this has changed thanks to her profits. She now needs a loan to continue strengthening her business with the purchase of materials such as clippers, artificial nails, brushes, acrylic of different colors, decorative stones and a lamp. Maribel wants to make this investment as December is approaching and that is when she works the most, so she wants to be prepared. 

"Thanks for trusting us and providing us with a loan to invest in each of our businesses", says Maribel.

* Maribel wears a striped shirt in the photo.

loans.use: to buy clippers, nails, brushes, acrylic in different colors, decorative stones and a lamp.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Jennelyn is very positive that she can improve  her business more if you will lend her 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from improving her business, Jennelyn aims to send her children to college. She is pretty sure that if she gives the best for her children's education, their lives will become more improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Adela has been in this business for 21 years. She also earns more income from food and vegetable vending. Adela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Genevie is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Genevie has a food vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years.

Genevie requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like chicken, pork, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

In the future, Genevie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Jane Rosaly

texts.en:
Jane Rosaly works hard to support her family. Jane Rosaly is widowed and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Jane Rosaly requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jane Rosaly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy crafts supplies (shells, wire, nylon threads, etc.)
